source: While word segmentation is a necessary step to process languages like Chinese and Japanese , its effects on Statistical Machine Translation ( SMT ) have not been discussed intensively in such languages .
target: While word segmentation is necessary for processing the Chinese and Japanese languages , its effects on Statistical Machine Translation ( SMT ) have not yet been thoroughly discussed for such languages .

source: In this paper , we investigate the effects of word segmentation methods on SMT , by comparing evaluation results of translation outputs while varying word segmentation methods .
target: In this paper , we investigate the effects of word segmentation methods on SMT , by comparing the evaluation results of the translation outputs , while varying word segmentation methods .

source: Additionally , meta-evaluations of evaluation metrics are also provided to investigate validity of the metrics .
target: Additionally , meta-evaluations of evaluation metrics are also provided to investigate the validity of the metrics .

source: The experiments revealed that supervised morphological analyzers were competitive , and considerably better than an unsupervised analyzer and a heuristic segmentation method .
target: The experimental results confirmed that supervised morphological analyzers were competitive with , and performed considerably better than an unsupervised analyzer and a heuristic segmentation method .

source: However , a character-based segmentation has achieved 10 .27 positive and 1 .95 negative differences in word-based and character-based BLEU , depending on corpus sizes and domains .
target: However , a character-based segmentation achieved 10 .27 positive and 1 .95 negative differences in word-based and character-based BLEU , depending on the corpus sizes and domains .

source: For this result we discuss the problem of the comparability of evaluation metrics and the possibility of better word segmentation than popular supervised morphological analyzers .
target: In conclusion , we discuss the problem of the comparability of evaluation metrics , and consider ways of improving word segmentation more than popular supervised morphological analyzers .

source: Several natural languages like Chinese and Japanese do not have to put spaces between words in their written forms .
target: Several languages , including Chinese and Japanese , do not require spaces between words , in their written forms .

source: In order to process such languages , we need to tokenize each sentence .
target: In order to process such languages , we need to tokenize each sentence .

source: This process is called word segmentation .
target: This process is called word segmentation .

source: Since the process is fundamental and indispensable , we need to explore how word segmentation affects Natural Language Processing applications .
target: Since word segmentation is a fundamental process , and is therefore indispensable , it is important that we explore how word segmentation affects Natural Language Processing applications .

source: Therefore , we investigate how Japanese word segmentation affects on SMT between English and Japanese , by comparing various word segmentation methods and evaluation metrics .
target: Thus , we investigate how Japanese word segmentation affects SMT between English and Japanese , by comparing various word segmentation methods and evaluation metrics .

source: The word segmentation methods includes both standard Japanese morphological analyzers and several heuristic methods .
target: The word segmentation methods include both standard Japanese morphological analyzers and several heuristic methods .

source: We also examine an unsupervised morphological analyzer and its results .
target: In addition , we examine an unsupervised morphological analyzer , and its results .

source: In addition , we focus on the meta-evaluation of the current evaluation metrics and find whether the metrics are consistent or not , when we vary word segmentation methods .
target: We focus on the meta-evaluation of the current evaluation metrics and determine whether the metrics are consistent or not , when we vary word segmentation methods .

source: Al-Haj and Lavie ( 2012 ) compared 12 heuristic word segmentation methods based on outputs of a standard Arabic POS tagger , and found the optimum combination in terms of BLEU on English-Arabic SMT .
target: Al-Haj and Lavie ( 2012 ) compared 12 heuristic word segmentation methods based on the outputs of a standard Arabic POS tagger , and found the optimum combination in terms of BLEU on English-Arabic SMT .

source: They acquired the 2 .3 score improvement from the worst to the best combinations .
target: They acquired a 2 .3 score improvement in comparing the worst to best combinations .

target: ( 2010 ) suggested a new short unit word segmentation standard in Chinese , which defines a more frequent string subset as a word .

target: For instance , one word “全球化 globalization ” was separated into two words “全球 global ” and “化 -lization ” .

target: However , it has not yet been discussed whether BLEU is a good metric for such an evaluation of word segmentation .

source: We measure the qualities of Japanese morphological analyzers and compare them with other word segmentation methods .
target: We measure the qualities of Japanese morphological analyzers and compare them with other word segmentation methods .

source: We also investigate consistencies of evaluation metrics by comparing results .
target: We also investigate consistencies of evaluation metrics by comparing the results .

source: This work aims to empirically compare representative word segmentation methods in terms of SMT quality .
target: This work aims at empirically comparing representative word segmentation methods in terms of the SMT quality .

source: The following experiments are designed in order to answer these questions :
target: The following experiments are designed in order to answer these questions :

source: - How a variety of word segmentation methods ( supervised morphological analysis , unsupervised segmentation , and heuristic methods ) affect SMT evaluation metrics , depending on corpus sizes and domains .
target: - How a variety of word segmentation methods ( supervised morphological analysis , unsupervised segmentation , and heuristic methods ) affects the SMT evaluation metrics , depending on the corpus sizes and domains .

source: - Whether or not SMT evaluation metrics provide a consistent measure while varying word segmentation methods .
target: - Whether or not SMT evaluation metrics provide a consistent measure , while varying word segmentation methods .

source: We setup word segmentation methods , corpora , and evaluation metrics as three parameters of our experiments to see the effects of Japanese word segmentation on SMT .
target: We set up word segmentation methods , corpora , and evaluation metrics , as the three parameters for our experiments , in order to observe the effects of Japanese word segmentation on SMT .

source: As shown in Table 1 , the following word segmentation methods output delimiters ( " | " represents a delimiter ) for a given input character sequence .
target: As shown in Table 1 , the following word segmentation methods output delimiters ( “| ” represents a delimiter ) for a given input character sequence .

source: The most popular method for Japanese word segmentation is to apply a morphological analyzer to obtain morpheme-based segmentation .
target: The most popular method for Japanese word segmentation is to apply a morphological analyzer to obtain morpheme-based segmentation .

source: It is , however , not clear which analyzer works better for the SMT task than the other analyzers .
target: It is ; however , unclear as to which analyzer works better for the SMT task .

source: Therefore , we use four representative morphological analyzers and compare them :
target: Therefore , we use four representative morphological analyzers and compare them :

source: - KyTea predicts word segmentation delimiters by pointwise prediction ( Neubig et al . , 2011 ) , using linear Support Vector Machine or logistic regression .
target: - KyTea predicts word segmentation delimiters by pointwise prediction ( Neubig et al . , 2011 ) , using linear Support Vector Machine or logistic regression .

source: - MeCab regards word segmentation as a sequence labeling problem .
target: - MeCab regards word segmentation as a sequence labeling problem .

source: It uses Conditional Random Field for learning ( Kudo et al . , 2004 ) .
target: It uses Conditional Random Field for learning ( Kudo et al . , 2004 ) .

source: - JUMAN also regards word segmentation as a sequence labeling , but it decides the minimum cost paths without machine learning , from segmentation and association costs in human annotated lexicons and automatically generated Web lexicons .
target: - JUMAN also regards word segmentation as a sequence labeling problem , but it decides the minimum cost paths without machine learning , from segmentation and association costs in human annotated lexicons and automatically generated Web lexicons .

source: The accuracy of supervised morphological analyzers KyTea , MeCab , and JUMAN is reported to be over 98\ % for news text .
target: The accuracy of supervised morphological analyzers KyTea , MeCab , and JUMAN is reported to be over 98 % for news texts .

source: On the other hand , the unsupervised method latticelm achieved 66 .6 % accuracy ( Mochihashi et al . , 2009 ) for human annotated news text , while the method does not have any answers of word definitions .
target: On the other hand , the unsupervised method , latticelm , achieved 66 .6 % accuracy ( Mochihashi et al . , 2009 ) for human annotated news texts , while the method does not have any answers for word definitions .

source: Therefore , it is not possible to compare such a result with the supervised results . Even though , it is fair to compare it with SMT contribution point of view .
target: Therefore , it is not possible to compare its result with the supervised results , even though it is fair to compare it from the SMT contribution point-of-view .

source: Furthermore , their policies about word segmentation definitions are very much different .
target: Furthermore , their policies concerning word segmentation definitions vary significantly .

source: While MeCab can change its definitions by external lexicons and JUMAN has its own internal standard , KyTea is based on the short unit standard of Balanced Corpus of Contemporary Written Japanese , which is considered one of the shortest definitions of Japanese words .
target: While MeCab can change its definitions by external lexicons , and JUMAN has its own internal standard , KyTea is based on the short unit standard of the Balanced Corpus of Contemporary Written Japanese , which is considered to have one of the shortest definitions of Japanese words .

source: For example , if we are given a string " 見れば ( if someone see ) " , MeCab separates it into two words " 見れ | ば " and JUMAN keep the same string , but KyTea outputs it as three words " 見 | れ | ば " where every character is a word .
target: For example , if we are given a string , “見れば ( if someone sees ) ” , MeCab separates it into two words , “見れ | ば ” and JUMAN retains the same string , but KyTea outputs it as three words , “見 | れ | ば ” where every character is a word .

source: In the case of latticelm , as it has no supervised definition of words , it uses the expectation maximized length of words for every word depending on training data .
target: For latticelm , since it has no supervised definition of words , it uses the expectation maximized length of words for every word , depending on the training data .

target: In our experiments , we further investigate such morphological analysis accuracies and word definition problems .

source: Therefore , we introduce two heuristic methods for Japanese word segmentation .
target: Therefore , we introduce two heuristic methods for Japanese word segmentation .

source: One is segmentation by character category ( CAT ) , and the other is segmentation by characters ( CHAR ) .
target: One method is segmentation by character category ( CAT ) , and the other is segmentation by characters ( CHAR ) .

source: CAT puts a word boundary when character categories change .
target: CAT places a word boundary when character categories change .

source: Character categories in Japanese include : Kanji ( Chinese character ) , Hiragana , Katakana , Latin alphabet , numeral digit , multi-byte alphabet , multi-byte digit , and other tokens .
target: Character categories in Japanese include : Kanji ( Chinese character ) , Hiragana , Katakana , Latin alphabet , numeral digit , multi-byte alphabet , multi-byte digit , and other tokens .

source: The CHAR method considers every Unicode character as a word as proposed by Xu et al .
target: The CHAR method considers every Unicode character as a word , as proposed by Xu et al .

source: We use two news corpora : Reuters corpora ( REUTERS ) and Japanese-English News Article Alignment Data ( JENAAD ) ( Utiyama and Isahara , 2003 ) .
target: We use two news corpora : Reuters corpora ( REUTERS ) and Japanese-English News Article Alignment Data ( JENAAD ) ( Utiyama and Isahara , 2003 ) .

source: Another corpus we use in the experiments is a Wikipedia corpus , Japanese-English Bilingual Corpus of Wikipedia 's Kyoto Articles 2 .01 ( WIKIPEDIA ) .
target: Another corpus we use in the experiments is a Wikipedia corpus : the Japanese-English Bilingual Corpus of Wikipedia 's Kyoto Articles 2 .01 ( WIKIPEDIA ) .

source: From these corpora , we prepared three data sets as explained below .
target: From these corpora , we prepared three data sets , as explained below .

source: In the case of REUTERS , we have used all 56 ,282 sentences .
target: For REUTERS , we used all 56 ,282 sentences .

target: Then , we split the data into three parts : the first 1 ,000 as the test , the next 500 as the development , and the remaining 55 ,282 as the training data .

source: In this data , we have combined JENAAD and REUTERS news corpora to get one news corpus .
target: For this data , we combined the JENAAD and REUTERS news corpora to acquire one news corpus .

target: We used all 56 ,282 and 150 ,000 sentences , respectively .

target: For each corpus , we divided the sentences into the first 1 ,000 for testing , the next 500 for development , and the remaining for training .

source: We have gathered 2000 , 1000 , and 203 ,782 sentences for test , development , and training , respectively , in total .
target: In total , we gathered 2000 , 1000 , and 203 ,782 sentences for test , development , and training , respectively .

source: We have launched two word-based evaluation methods : BLEU ( Papineni et al . , 2002 ) with 4-gram setting and RIBES ( Isozaki et al . , 2010a ) , which has been reported to have a much higher correlation to human evaluation than BLEU within English-Japanese translation tasks ( Sudoh et al . , 2011 ) .
target: We have launched two word-based evaluation methods : BLEU ( Papineni et al . , 2002 ) with 4-gram setting and RIBES ( Isozaki et al . , 2010a ) , which has been reported to have a much higher correlation to human evaluation than BLEU within English-Japanese translation tasks ( Sudoh et al . , 2011 ) .

source: Currently , the most popular way to evaluate Statistical Machine Translation is to use word-based evaluation metrics such as BLEU and RIBES .
target: Currently , the most popular way to evaluate SMT is to use word-based evaluation metrics , such as BLEU and RIBES .

source: However , these word-based evaluation metrics have a problem on independency of word segmentation evaluations .
target: However , these word-based evaluation metrics have a problem on independency of word segmentation evaluations .

source: If we do not have segmented reference and test data , we cannot evaluate outputs by word-based evaluation metrics .
target: If we do not have segmented reference and test data , we cannot evaluate the outputs by word-based evaluation metrics .

source: For example , in the case of English-Japanese translations , we must tokenize reference data to evaluate SMT outputs .
target: For example , for English-Japanese translations , we must tokenize reference data to evaluate SMT outputs .

source: On the other hand , in the case of Japanese-English translations , we must tokenize test data to evaluate the outputs .
target: On the other hand , for Japanese-English translations , we must tokenize test data to evaluate the outputs .

source: As a result , we need to tokenize every sentence by word segmentation before evaluation , and it is hard to independently evaluate the effects of word segmentation on training data .
target: As a result , we need to tokenize every sentence by word segmentation before evaluation , and it is therefore difficult to independently evaluate the effects of word segmentation on training data .

source: It is also possible to detokenize SMT outputs first , and then tokenize them by the shared word segmentation .
target: It is also possible to detokenize SMT outputs first , and then tokenize them by the shared word segmentation .

target: However , our preliminary experiments indicated that the results obtained with this method were not independent from word segmentation of the training data .

source: And the best results were obtained when we use the same word segmentation as the training data .
target: The best results were obtained when we used the same word segmentation as the training data .

source: Hence , this problem remains if we keep our word-based evaluations .
target: Hence , if we keep our word-based evaluations , this problem remains .

source: In order to manage such a problem , we use one character-based metric BLEU in Characters ( De-noual and Lepage , 2005 ) with 4-gram .
target: In order to manage this issue , we used one character-based metric BLEU in Characters ( De-noual and Lepage , 2005 ) with 4-gram .

source: As this method evaluates the character-level information , outputs are not required to be segmented and it is free from word segmentation variations .
target: As this method evaluates the character-level information , outputs are not required to be segmented , and it is free from word segmentation variations .

source: We have conducted English and Japanese machine translation in both directions by the following steps :
target: We have conducted English and Japanese machine translation in both directions , following the steps below :

source: 1Apply the Head-Finalization ( Isozaki et al . , 2010b ) to English text in the case of English-Japanese translation .
target: 1 .Apply the Head-Finalization ( Isozaki et al . , 2010b ) to English text in the case of English-Japanese translation .

source: 2Run Japanese word segmentation methods and a normalization script which was introduced by the NTCIR-9 PATMT task .
target: 2 .Run Japanese word segmentation methods and a normalization script , which was introduced by the NTCIR-9 PATMT task .

source: 3Tokenize and lowercase English text by Moses ' tokenizer and lowercase scripts .
target: 3 .Tokenize and lowercase English texts by Moses ' tokenizer and lowercase scripts .

source: 4Create language models from target languages ' training data , with SRILM 1 .5 .12 .
target: 4 .Create language models from target languages ' training data , with SRILM 1 .5 .12 .

source: 5Create translation models with Giza+ + 1 .0 .5 ( 2011-09-24 ) .
target: 5 .Create translation models with Giza+ + 1 .0 .5 ( 2011-09-24 ) .

source: 6Decode source test data with Moses ( 2010-08-13 ) .
target: 6 .Decode source test data with Moses ( 2010-08-13 ) .

source: 7Compute evaluation scores of the outputs .
target: 7 .Compute evaluation scores of the outputs .

source: We used Enju 2 .4 .2 ( Miyao and Tsujii , 2005 ) and Head Finalization ( Isozaki et al . , 2010b ) to preprocess English data .
target: We used Enju 2 .4 .2 ( Miyao and Tsujii , 2005 ) and Head Finalization ( Isozaki et al . , 2010b ) to preprocess English data .

source: This method enabled more accurate translations within English-Japanese translations than the conventional settings .
target: This method enabled more accurate translations within English-Japanese translations than with the conventional settings .

source: We have applied the following Head Finalization rules from ( Su-doh et al . , 2011 ) :
target: We have applied the following Head Finalization rules from ( Su-doh et al . , 2011 ) :

source: - Reverse each phrase 's word orders when the phrase does not end with a head .
target: - Reverse each phrase 's word orders when the phrase does not end with a head .

source: - Exclude coordination from reversing
target: - Exclude coordination from reversing

source: - Convert plural nouns to singular forms
target: - Convert plural nouns to singular forms

source: - Remove articles " a " , " an " , and " the "
target: - Remove articles “a” , “an” , and “the”

source: - Insert pseudo-particles _va0 , _va1 , and _va2 .
target: - Insert pseudo-particles _va0 , _va1 , and _va2 .

source: For the pseudo-particles , we use the following insertion rules ( arg1 and arg2 are swapped when the head verb 's voice is passive ) :
target: For the pseudo-particles , we use the following insertion rules ( arg1 and arg2 are swapped when the head verb 's voice is passive ) :

source: - Add _va0 after the arg1 entry of the sentence head verb
target: - Add _va0 after the arg1 entry of the sentence head verb

source: - Add _va1 after arg1 entries of other verbs
target: - Add _va1 after arg1 entries of other verbs

source: - Add _va2 after arg2 entries of all verbs
target: - Add _va2 after arg2 entries of all verbs

source: On Contribution of Syntactic Dependencies to Word Sense Disambiguation
target: On Contribution of Syntactic Dependencies to Word Sense Disambiguation

source: Traditionally , many researchers have addressed word sense disambiguation ( WSD ) as an independent classification problem for each word .
target: Traditionally , many researchers have addressed word sense disambiguation ( WSD ) as an independent classification problem for each word .

source: However , problems with their approaches are the disregard of the interdependencies of word senses , and the limited applicability to those word senses for which training instances are served .
target: However , the problem with these approaches , is that they disregard the interdependencies of word senses , and that it is limited in its applicability to the word senses for which training instances are served .**[<-This sentence is a bit confusing ]

source: In this paper , we propose a supervised WSD model based on the syntactic dependencies of word senses .
target: In this paper , we propose a supervised WSD model based on the syntactic dependencies of word senses .

source: Particularly , we assume that there exist strong dependencies between the sense of a syntactic head and those of its dependents .
target: In particular , we assume that strong dependencies between the sense of a syntactic head and those of its dependents exist .

source: We describe these dependencies on the tree-structured conditional random fields ( T-CRFs ) , and obtain the most appropriate assignment of senses optimized over the sentence .
target: We describe these dependencies on the tree-structured conditional random fields ( T-CRFs ) , and obtain the most appropriate assignment of senses optimized over the sentence .

source: Also , we define these sense dependencies in combination with various coarse-grained sense tag sets , so that our model can even work for words that do not appear in the training data , and these combined features help relieve the data sparseness problem .
target: Furthermore , we define these sense dependencies in combination with various coarse-grained sense tag sets , so that our model can also work for words that do not appear in the training data ; these combined features help relieve the data sparseness problem .

source: In experiments , we show the appropriateness of considering the sense dependencies , as well as the advantage of the combination of fine - and coarse-grained tag sets .
target: In experiments , we display the appropriateness of considering the sense dependencies , as well as the advantage of [having ? Using ? ] the combination of fine - and coarse-grained tag sets .

source: The performance of our model is shown to be comparable to those of state-of-the-art WSD systems .
target: The performance of our model is shown to be comparable to those of state-of-the-art WSD systems .

source: We also present an in-depth analysis on the effectiveness of the sense dependency features with intuitive examples .
target: We also present an in-depth analysis of the effectiveness of the sense dependency features by using intuitive examples .

source: Word sense disambiguation ( WSD ) is one of the fundamental problems in computational linguistics .
target: Word sense disambiguation ( WSD ) is one of the most fundamental problems in computational linguistics .

source: The task of WSD is to resolve the inherent polysemy of words by determining the appropriate sense ( s ) for each polysemous word in a given text .
target: The task of WSD is to resolve the inherent polysemy of words by determining the appropriate sense ( s ) for each polysemous word in a given text .

source: It is considered to be an intermediate , but necessary step toward many NLP applications including machine translation and information extraction , which require the knowledge of word senses to achieve better performance .
target: It is considered to be an intermediate , but necessary step for many NLP applications , including machine translation and information extraction , which[what does " which " refer to ? Machine translation ? Information extraction , or both ? Clarify ] require the knowledge of word senses to perform better .

source: One major obstacle to large-scale and precise WSD is the data sparseness problem caused by the fine-grainedness of the sense distinction .
target: One major obstacle for large-scale and precise WSD is solving the data sparseness problem caused by the fine-grained nature of sense distinction .

source: In order to resolve this problem , several semi-supervised approaches have been explored in recent years .
target: In recent years in order to resolve this problem , several semi-supervised approaches have been explored .

source: Some researchers have addressed directly the scarcity of the training data , and explored the methods to obtain more tagged instances , by the co-training and self-training .
target: Some researchers have addressed the scarcity of the training data directly , and have explored the methods to obtain more tagged instances , by co-training and self-training .

source: Other researchers have employed useful global information , such as the domain information extracted from unannotated corpora .
target: Other researchers have employed useful global information , such as the domain information extracted from unannotated corpora .

source: Although the use of the global information has succeeded in dramatically increase the performance of WSD , there are much room left to examine the effectiveness of local or syntactic information .
target: Although the use of global information has succeeded in dramatically increasing the performance of WSD , there is much room left to examine the effectiveness of local or syntactic information .

source: One of such information yet to be explored is the interdependencies of word senses .
target: One such information yet to be explored , is the interdependency of word senses .

source: Although the use of local and syntactic information has been common in WSD , traditional approaches to WSD are based on the individual classification framework for each word , in which each word 's sense is treated independently , regardless of any interdependencies nor cooccurrences of word senses .
target: Although the use of local and syntactic information has been common in WSD , traditional approaches to WSD are based on the individual classification framework for each word ; each word 's sense is treated independently , regardless of any interdependencies or cooccurrences of word senses .

source: As a result , the resulting sense assignment may not semantically consistent over the sentence .
target: In turn , the resulting sense assignment may not be semantically consistent over the sentence .

source: To solve this problem is of great interest from both practical and theoretical perspectives .
target: To solve this problem is of great interest from both a practical and theoretical viewpoint .

source: In this thesis , we present a WSD model that naturally handles all content words in a sentence .
target: In this thesis , we present a WSD model that naturally handles all content words in a sentence .

source: We focus on the use of the interdependency of word senses , so that we can directly address the issue of semantic ambiguity of a whole sentence arose from the interaction of each word 's sense ambiguity .
target: We focus on using the interdependency of word senses , so that we can directly address the issue of semantic ambiguity in a whole sentence that arose from the interaction of each word 's sense ambiguity . **[ < - this part is confusing . ]

source: Specifically , we assume that there exist strong sense dependencies between a syntactic head and its dependents in the dependency tree , rather than between neighboring words in the sentence .
target: Specifically , we assume that are strong sense dependencies between a syntactic head , and its dependents in the dependency tree , rather than between neighboring words of a sentence .

source: We confirm the appropriateness of this assumption by showing the superiority of the tree-structured models over the linear-chain models .
target: We confirm the validity of this assumption , by showing the superiority of the tree-structured models over the linear-chain models .

source: Furthermore , we combine these sense dependency features with various coarse-grained sense tag sets .
target: Furthermore , we combine these sense dependency features with various coarse-grained sense tag sets .

source: This is to relieve the data sparseness problem caused by the explosion of the number of features , which is roughly squared by the combination of two word senses .
target: This is to relieve the data sparseness problem caused by the explosion in the number of features , which is roughly squared by the combination of two word senses .

source: The combined features also enable our model to work even for those words that do not appear in the training data , which the traditional individual classifiers cannot handle .
target: The combined features also enable our model to work , even for words that do not appear in the training data , which traditional individual classifiers cannot handle .

source: As a machine learning method , we adopt the tree-structured conditional random fields ( T-CRFs ) .
target: As a machine learning method , we adopt the tree-structured conditional random fields ( T-CRFs ) .

source: We solve WSD as a labeling problem to a sentence described as a dependency tree , where the vertices correspond to words and the edges correspond to the sense dependencies .
target: We solve WSD as a labeling problem to a sentence described as a dependency tree , where the vertices correspond to the words , and the edges correspond to the sense dependencies .

source: In this model , the intensities of the sense dependencies are described as the weights of edge features .
target: In this model , the intensities of the sense dependencies are described as the weights of edge features .

source: T-CRFs also enable us to incorporate various sense tag sets all together in a simple framework .
target: T-CRFs also enable us to incorporate various sense tag sets all together into a simple framework .

source: In our experiments , three interesting results are found : the interdependency of word senses contribute to the improvement of WSD models , the combined features with coarse-grained sense tags work effectively , and the tree-structured model outperforms the linear-chain model .
target: In our experiments , three interesting results are found : the interdependency of word senses contribute to the improvement of WSD models , the combined features with coarse-grained sense tags work effectively , and the tree-structured model outperforms the linear-chain model .

source: These results are confirmed on three data sets ( the SemCor corpus and the Senseval-2 and -3 English all-words task test sets ) and on two sense inventories ( WordNet synsets and supersenses ) .
target: These results are confirmed on three data sets ( the SemCor corpus and the Senseval-2 and -3 English all-words task test sets ) , and on two sense inventories ( WordNet synsets and supersenses ) .

source: Our final model is shown to perform comparably with state-of-the-art WSD systems .
target: Our final model is shown to perform comparably to state-of-the-art WSD systems .

source: The rest of the paper is organized as follows : In Section 2 , we describe background topics related to WSD .
target: The rest of the paper is organized as follows : In Section 2 , we describe background topics related to WSD .

source: In Section 3 , we describe current problems of WSD , and related works .
target: In Section 3 , we describe current problems of WSD , and related works .

source: In Section 4 , we describe our model with intuitive examples , and the machine learning method we use .
target: In Section 4 , we describe our model with intuitive examples , and we describe the machine learning method that we use .

source: In Section 5 , 6 , and 7 , we present our experimental setup and results , and an in-depth analysis on the contribution of the sense dependency features .
target: In Section 5 , 6 , and 7 , we present our experimental setup , the results , and an in-depth analysis on the contribution of the sense dependency features .

source: Finally , in Section 8 , we present concluding remarks .
target: Finally , in Section 8 , we present our concluding remarks .

source: The WordNet is a broad-coverage machine-readable dictionary ( MRD ) for English , which contains about 150 ,000 words .
target: The WordNet is a broad-coverage machine-readable dictionary ( MRD ) for English , containing about 150 ,000 words .

source: It also serves as an ontology , in which various kinds of meta data , relations among words and senses , and well-organized hierarchical classification of word senses are defined .
target: WordNet also serves as an ontology of various kinds of meta data , relations among words and senses , and a well-organized hierarchical classification of word senses that are defined .

source: In this paper , we always refer to the WordNet version 2 .0 unless otherwise noted .
target: In this paper , we always refer to the WordNet version 2 .0 unless otherwise noted .

source: The statistical information of the WordNet 2 .0 is shown in Table 1 and 2 .
target: The statistical information of the WordNet 2 .0 is shown in Table 1 and 2 .

source: In the WordNet , nouns and verbs are organized in hierarchical structures with IS-A ( hypernym-hyponym ) relationships among words , as shown in Figure 1 .
target: As shown in Figure 1 , in WordNet , nouns and verbs are organized into hierarchical structures with IS-A ( hypernym-hyponym ) relationships among words , .

source: Nouns have a far deeper structure than verbs , while that of verbs is transversely developed .
target: Nouns have a far deeper structure than verbs do , while that the structure of verbs is transversely developed .

source: All nouns and verbs except some top-level concepts are classified into primitive groups called supersenses , which we describe later .
target: All nouns and verbs , with the exception of some top-level concepts , are classified into primitive groups called supersenses , which we will describe later .

source: Figure 1 shows the WordNet hierarchical structure for the first sense ( financial bank ) of a noun bank , where each line shows a synset with the list of words headed by its supersense label , and an arrow denotes that two synsets are in an IS-A relation .
target: Figure 1 shows the WordNet hierarchical structure for the first sense ( financial bank ) of a noun bank , where each line indicates a synset with the list of words headed by its supersense label ; an arrow denotes that the two synsets are in an IS-A relation .

target: Note that since the organizations of adjectives and adverbs are very different from those of nouns and verbs , we use this hierarchical information for only nouns and verbs .

source: A supersense is a coarse-grained semantic category , with which each noun or verb synset in WordNet is associated .
target: A supersense is a coarse-grained semantic category , with which each noun or verb synset in WordNet is associated .

source: Exploiting Motion Patterns for Action Recognition with Depth Sequences
target: Exploiting Motion Patterns for Action Recognition with Depth Sequences

source: Dense trajectory-based approaches on 2D video have been demontrated state of the art at action recognition since it can capture most discriminative motion patterns .
target: Dense trajectory-based approaches have been used to recognize actions in 2D video because they can capture most discriminative motion patterns .

source: However , there are not many studies related to exploiting the discriminative motion patterns in depth video .
target: However , there are not many studies related to exploiting discriminative motion patterns in depth video .

source: In this work , we extend the dense trajectory-based approach on depth video and show its effectiveness for action recognition .
target: In this study , we extend the dense trajectory-based approach to depth video and show its effectiveness at recognizing actions .

source: To achieve an effective extension , we extract dense trajectories on 2D videos transformed from depth video .
target: In particular , dense trajectories are extracted from depth video .

source: The 2D videos are formed from views which can capture the discriminative motion patterns similar to observing actions from different directions .
target: These 2D videos are formed from views which capture the discriminative motion patterns similar to observing actions from different directions .

source: We evaluate this approach on framework of action recognition using the benchmark MSR Action 3D , MSR Gesture 3D and 3D Action Pairs datasets .
target: We evaluate this approach to action recognition on the benchmark MSR Action 3D , MSR Gesture 3D and 3D Action Pairs datasets .

source: Evaluation results show that our proposed approach is effective for action recognition on depth video and outperforms the state-of-the-art approaches .
target: The results of the evaluation indicate that our approach is effective at recognizing actions in depth video and outperforms other state-of-the-art approaches .

source: Action recognition in videos has been one of the active research fields in the computer vision </CITE> , due to its wide applications in areas like surveillance , video retrieval , human-computer interaction , and smart environments .
target: The recognition of actions depicted in videos is an active topic of research in the computer vision field </CITE> , and it has a diverse range of applications in areas like surveillance , video retrieval , human-computer interaction , and smart environments .

source: Due to the diversity and complexity of actions , as well as complicated environment ( e.g background clutter and illumination variation ) , action recognition is still a challenging problem .
target: As a result of the diversity and complexity of actions , as well as the complicated nature of most environments ( e.g . , background clutter and illumination variation ) , action recognition is still a challenging problem .

source: Recent approaches can be divided into three major categories : silhouette-based </CITE> , salient point-based </CITE> and trajectory-based </CITE> .
target: Recent approaches can be divided into three major categories : silhouette-based </CITE> , salient point-based </CITE> and trajectory-based </CITE> .

source: All approaches basically try to capture motion information that appears in videos , since the motion is crucial information for presenting actions .
target: All of these approaches basically try to capture motion information appearing in videos , since it is crucial information for presenting actions .

source: Based on recent works </CITE> , exploiting discriminative motion patterns has been demonstrated successful at action recognition .
target: Recent studies </CITE> have shown that exploiting discriminative motion patterns is a successful means of action recognition .

source: Most existing studies mainly have investigate on video sequences captured by traditional 2D cameras .
target: Most of the existing studies deal with video sequences captured by traditional 2D cameras .

source: Although , there are many improvements on motion pattern-based approach for action recognition in the domain of 2D video </CITE> , the mentioned challenges ( e.g . background clutter , illumination variation ) are still difficult to handle .
target: Although , there have been many improvements to the motion pattern-based approach for 2D video </CITE> , the above - mentioned challenges ( e.g . background clutter and illumination variation ) are still difficult to meet .

source: With the development of new RGB-D cameras , e.g . Kinect camera , capturing RGB images as well as together with depth maps has become more easily in real time .
target: Meanwhile , the advent of RGB-D cameras , e.g . , the Kinect camera , has made it easier to capture depth maps together with RGB images in real time .

source: The depth maps can enrich information for cues , such as body shape and motion information .
target: The depth maps enrich the information available as cues , such as the shape of body and its motions .

source: In addition , depth information is less sensitive to the challenges RGB information usually deals with .
target: In addition , the depth information in these maps is less sensitive to the problems affecting RGB information .

source: Due to these advantages , recent research trend concentrates on exploiting depth maps for action recognition </CITE> .
target: Because of these advantages , recent research has concentrated on exploiting depth maps for action recognition </CITE> .

source: However , to the best of our knowledge , none success is related to combining discriminative motion pattern-based approach , the state-of-the-art on 2D video , on in depth video .
target: However , to the best of our knowledge , none have succeeded in developing a discriminative motion pattern-based approach , the state-of-the-art for 2D video , for depth video .

source: In this paper , we investigate this approach with on depth sequences .
target: In this paper , we investigate this approach for depth sequences .

source: Key idea of motion pattern-based approach is to capture discriminative trajectories in video .
target: The key idea of the motion pattern-based approach is to capture discriminative trajectories in video .

source: Therefore , in order to effectively exploit this approach on depth video , it is necessary to extract the trajectories from depth video .
target: Therefore , to effectively exploit this approach on depth video , it is necessary to extract trajectories from depth video .

source: To do that , a straightforward method is to consider depth value as intensity value , extract trajectories on the 2D video , and apply standard motion analysis technique for 2D data .
target: To do that , a straightforward method is to consider the depth value as an intensity value , extract trajectories from the 2D video , and apply standard motion analysis techniques for 2D data .

target: Unfortunately , this method will expose the inherent limitations of the 2D trajectory-based approaches and will result in confused motion patterns that cannot be distinguished by observing 2D videos from one view .

source: For example , forward punch and hammer may be confused actions , if we view them from front , since they contain indistinguishable front view movements respectively : `` lift arm up '' and `` stretch out '' .
target: For example , a forward punch and hammer may be confused if we view them from the front because they contain `` lift arm up '' and `` stretch out '' movements that are indistinguishable when viewed from the front .

source: However , if we properly use the depth information in motion pattern analysis , it is possible to extract discriminative motion patterns which is inaccessible from one fixed view but available from multiple different view directions .
target: However , if we properly use the depth information in the motion pattern analysis , it is possible to extract discriminative motion patterns which are inaccessible from one fixed view but discernible from different views .

target: In our experiments , we use a dense trajectory-based approach </CITE> that exploits discriminative motion patterns ; this is the state-of-the-art approach for recognizing actions depicted in 2D videos .

target: The results show that our method outperforms other state-of-the-art methods at recognizing actions using depth data .

source: Our key contributions of this paper are as follows : ( 1 ) we propose an effective method to exploit trajectories in depth video , ( 2 ) we perform comprehensive experiments on the challenging benchmark dataset and indicate that our proposed method is the best compared with the state-of-the-art depth-based methods .
target: Our key contributions are as follows : ( 1 ) we propose an effective method to exploit trajectories in depth video , and ( 2 ) we perform comprehensive experiments on a challenging benchmark dataset and indicate that our method is the best of the state-of-the-art depth-based methods .

source: In terms of action recognition in 2D video , there are three popular approaches used in several action recognition systems , including silhouette-based , salient point-based and trajectory-based .
target: There are three popular approaches to action recognition in 2D video : silhouette-based , salient point-based and trajectory-based .

source: The silhouette-based approach , as described in </CITE> , is powerful since it encodes a great deal of information in a sequence of images .
target: The silhouette-based approach , as described in </CITE> , is powerful since it encodes a great deal of information in a sequence of images .

source: However , it is sensitive to pose changes , noise , and occlusions .
target: However , it is sensitive to pose changes , noise , and occlusions .

source: Besides , it depends on the accuracy of localization , background subtraction , or tracking for exactly extracting region of interest .
target: In addition , it depends on the accuracy of the localization , background subtraction , and tracking when extracting the region of interest .

source: Another approach based on salient points , generates a compact video representation and accepts background clutter , occlusions and scale changes .
target: Another approach , based on salient points , generates a compact video representation and can deal with background clutter , occlusions , and scale changes .

source: The effectiveness of this approach is also showed in several works </CITE> .
target: This approach has been shown to be effective in several studies </CITE> .

source: However , in case of recognizing complicated motions , the salient point-based approach has to deal with several challenges ; due to the lack of a relationship among salient points .
target: However , in the case of recognizing complicated motions , the salient point-based approach has to deal with several challenges due to the lack of relationships among the salient points .

source: In recent studies </CITE> , the trajectory-based approach captures motion patterns in video .
target: Recent studies </CITE> have used the trajectory-based approach to capture motion patterns in video .

source: Although the motion patterns provide even very complicated , structured motion , which are perceived easily by human subject , as shown by Johansson </CITE> .
target: Although motion patterns are very complicated , structured motion can be easily perceived by humans , as has been shown by Johansson </CITE> .

source: Most recent and effective methods exploiting depth information are categorized into two major directions .
target: The most recent methods of exploiting depth information can be categorized into two major types .

source: The first one is to adapt 2D techniques based methods for depth data .
target: The first one is to adapt 2D techniques to depth data .

source: The second one is to propose 3D techniques for directly exploiting depth data .
target: The second one is to devise 3D techniques for directly exploiting depth data .

source: For the first direction , X.Yang et al . </CITE> propose the Depth Motion Maps ( DMM ) which is alble to capture global activities in depth sequences .
target: Regarding the first direction , X.Yang et al . </CITE> propose Depth Motion Maps ( DMMs ) to capture global activities in depth sequences .

source: The DMM are generated by stacking motion energy of depth maps projected to three orthogonal Cartesian planes .
target: DMMs are generated by stacking the motion energy of depth maps projected on three orthogonal Cartesian planes .

source: And the Histogram of Oriented Gradients ( HOG ) </CITE> are computed from the DMM to represent an action video .
target: A Histogram of Oriented Gradients ( HOG ) </CITE> is computed from the DMMs to represent an action video .

source: The approach can accumulate more silhouette information from the projections .
target: The approach can accumulate more silhouette information from the projections .

target: However , silhouette extraction is not a trivial task due to problems such as occlusion and poor data quality .

source: Another approach proposed by L Xia and J.K Aggarwal </CITE> presents a filtering method to extract spatio-temporal interest points from depth videos ( DSTIPs ) .
target: Another approach , proposed by L. Xia and J.K. Aggarwal </CITE> , is to use filtering to extract spatio-temporal interest points from depth videos ( DSTIPs ) .

source: In this approach , they extend a work of Dollar et al . </CITE> to adapt for depth data .
target: It is an extension of the work of Dollar et al . </CITE> to depth data .

source: Firstly , 2D and 1D filters ( e.g . Gaussian and Gabor filters ) are applied respectively on to the spatial dimensions and temporal dimension in depth video .
target: First , 2D and 1D filters ( e.g . Gaussian and Gabor filters ) are respectively applied to the spatial dimensions and temporal dimension of the depth video .

source: A correction function then is used to suppress points as depth noises .
target: A correction function is used to suppress points that are depth noise .

source: Finally , points with the largest responses by this filtering method will be selected as the DSTIPs for each video .
target: The points with the largest responses resulting from this filtering are selected as the DSTIPs for each video .

source: Besides , a depth cuboid similarity feature ( DCSF ) is proposed to describe a 3D cuboid around the DSTIPs with supporting size to be adaptable to the depth .
target: In addition , a depth cuboid similarity feature ( DCSF ) is used to describe a 3D cuboid around the DSTIPs with supporting size to be adaptable to the depth .

source: This work has demonstrated the effectiveness of 2D techniques applied for depth data .

source: Therefore , this approach has to deal with the challenges as mentioned in 2D video data .

target: Unlike </CITE> , the methods described in </CITE> use occupancy patterns to represent features in action videos .

source: A.W. Vieira et al . </CITE> proposed a new feature descriptor , called Space-Time Occupancy Patterns ( STOP ) .
target: A.W. Vieira et al . </CITE> proposed a new feature descriptor , called Space-Time Occupancy Patterns ( STOP ) .

source: This descriptor is formed by sparse cells divided by the sequence of depth maps in a 4D space-time grid .
target: This descriptor is formed from the sparse cells of a 4D space-time grid dividing up a sequence of depth maps .

source: The values of the sparse cells are determined by points inside to be on the silhouettes or moving parts of the body .
target: The points inside the sparse cells are typically on the silhouette or on the moving parts of an object .

source: J. Wang et al . </CITE> presented semi-local features , called Random Occupancy Pattern ( ROP ) features , from randomly sampled 4D sub-volumes with different sizes and different locations .
target: J. Wang et al . </CITE> created semi-local features , called Random Occupancy Pattern ( ROP ) features , from randomly sampled 4D sub-volumes of different sizes and at different locations .

source: The random sampling is performed under a weighted scheme to effectively explore the large dense sampling space .
target: The random sampling is performed according to a weighted scheme in order to effectively explore the large dense sampling space .

source: Besides , authors also apply a sparse coding approach to robustly encode these features .
target: The authors also used sparse coding to robustly encode these features .

source: The work by J. Wang et al . </CITE> designed a feature , to describe the local `` depth appearance '' for each joint , named Local Occupancy Patterns ( LOP ) .
target: J. Wang et al . </CITE> designed features , named Local Occupancy Patterns ( LOPs ) , to describe the local `` depth appearance '' of each joint of the body .

source: The LOP features are computed based on 3D point cloud around a particular joint .
target: LOP features are computed on the basis of a 3D point cloud around a particular joint .

source: Moreover , they concatenate the LOP features with skeleton information-based features and apply Short Fourier Transform to obtain the Fourier Temporal Pyramid features at each joint .

source: The Fourier features are utilized in a novel actionlet ensemble model to represent each action video .
target: The Fourier features are utilized in a novel actionlet ensemble model to represent each action in the video .

source: Recently , Oreifej and Liu </CITE> presented a new descriptor for depth maps , named Histogram of Oriented 4D Surface Normals ( HON4D ) .
target: Recently , Oreifej and Liu </CITE> presented a new descriptor for depth maps , named Histogram of Oriented 4D Surface Normals ( HON4D ) .

source: To construct the HON4D , firstly , the 4D normal vectors are computed from the depth sequence .
target: To construct the HON4D , 4D normal vectors are first computed from the depth sequence .

source: At the next step , the 4D normal vectors is distributed into spatio-temporal cells .
target: Next , these 4D normal vectors are distributed into spatio-temporal cells .

source: To quantize the 4D normal vectors , the 4D space is quantized by using vertices of a regular polychoron .
target: To quantize the 4D normal vectors , the 4D space is quantized by using the vertices of a regular polychoron .

source: The quantization , then , is refined by additional projectors to make the 4D normal vectors in each cell denser and more discriminative .
target: The quantization is refined by additional projectors to make the 4D normal vectors in each cell denser and more discriminative .

source: Afterwards , the HON4D features in cells are concatenated to represent a depth action video .
target: Afterwards , the HON4D features in the cells are concatenated to make depth video depicting actions .

source: In this section , we present a unified action recognition framework on depth data .
target: Here , we present a unified action recognition framework for depth data .

source: We extract discriminative motion patterns from multiple views and then apply a bag-of-words ( BoW ) model to compute feature vectors for the feature fusion scheme .
target: We extract discriminative motion patterns from multiple views and apply a bag-of-words ( BoW ) model to them to compute feature vectors for the feature fusion scheme .

source: The motivation of using a bag-of-words model to action recognition is to handle a variable number of motion patterns produced by arbitrary movements from various subjects .
target: The motivation behind using the bag-of-words model is that it can handle a variable number of motion patterns produced by arbitrary movements from various subjects .

source: The fused feature vectors computed from a bag-of-words model are input of classifiers in training and testing phases .

source: Following subsections provide concise descriptions about processes in our framework .
target: The following steps are concise descriptions of the processes in our framework .

source: Projection : In this step , key problem is to find appropriate action representation to effectively captures discriminative motion patterns .
target: Projection : In this step , the problem is to find an action representation that effectively captures discriminative motion patterns .

source: Currently , capturing the motion patterns has not been achieved specific successes on 3D data in comparison with 2D data .
target: Currently , capturing motion patterns in 3D data has had less success than in 2D data .

source: Therefore , at this step , we try to present each 3D action through a combination of 2D actions .
target: Therefore , in this step , we try to represent each 3D action as a combination of 2D actions .

source: To do that , M depth maps are projected onto N view planes to obtain corresponding 2D action videos .
target: To do that , M depth maps are projected onto N view planes to obtain corresponding 2D action videos .

source: After the projection , each 2D motion video is abstracted by several local motion patterns .
target: After the projection , each 2D motion video is abstracted by using several local motion patterns .

source: Feature Extraction : In order to capture discriminative motion patterns on the 2D videos , we adopt the trajectory based approach .
target: Feature Extraction : Here , we use a trajectory-based approach to capture discriminative motion patterns in the 2D videos .

source: With this approach , we can keep away from the challenges from human body segmentation as well as skeleton extraction .
target: With this approach , we can avoid problems related to segmentation of the human body as well as skeleton extraction .

source: Trajectory-aligned descriptors are then calculated on the extracted trajectories to build N `` bags of motion patterns '' corresponding to N views .
target: Trajectory-aligned descriptors are then calculated on the extracted trajectories in order to build N `` bags of motion patterns '' corresponding to N views .

source: Clustering : The clustering step is to convert a `` bag of motion patterns '' from dataset to a `` bag of quantized motion patterns '' .
target: Clustering : The clustering step converts the `` bag of motion patterns '' from the dataset into a `` bag of quantized motion patterns '' .

source: A quantized motion pattern can be considered as a representative of several similar motion patterns .
target: A quantized motion pattern can be considered to be representative of several similar motion patterns .

source: A standard clustering method ( e.g . k-means ) can be applied over all the motion patterns .
target: A standard clustering method ( e.g . k-means ) can be applied to all the motion patterns .

source: Quantized motion patterns are then defined as the centers of the learned clusters .
target: Quantized motion patterns are then defined as the centers of the learned clusters .

source: The number of the clusters is the size of `` bag of quantized motion patterns '' .
target: The number of clusters is the size of the `` bag of quantized motion patterns '' .

source: Quantization and Fusion : To represent an action with captured motion patterns , we map each “ motion pattern “ to a certain `` quantized motion pattern '' through the matching process .
target: Quantization and Fusion : To represent an action with captured motion patterns , we map each “ motion pattern “ to a certain `` quantized motion pattern '' through the matching process .

source: Afterwards , the histogram of the quantized motion patterns is generated to represent action on a corresponding view .
target: Afterwards , a histogram of the quantized motion patterns is generated to represent the action in the corresponding view .

source: After that , the histograms generated from all views are concatenated to form a larger feature vector as input to classifiers .
target: After that , the histograms generated from all views are concatenated to form a larger feature vector as input to the classifiers .

source: Since each individual feature vector has the same meaning , the feature fusion can guarantee the effectiveness to represent action .
target: Since each individual feature vector has the same meaning , the feature fusion can guarantee the effectiveness of the action representation .

source: Training and Testing : After the final feature representations are generated , we separate them into two histogram databases for training and testing phases .
target: Training and Testing : After the final feature representations are generated , we separate them into two histogram databases for the training and testing phases .

source: We use a machine learning method such as Support Vector Machine ( SVM ) for classification .
target: We use a machine learning method such as Support Vector Machine ( SVM ) to make the classification .

source: Clustering : Purpose of this step is to learn a visual vocabulary or codebook .
target: Clustering : The purpose of this step is to learn a visual vocabulary or codebook .

source: Corresponding to three views : front , side and top , we create three codebooks ( i .e . three bags of quantized motion patterns ) .
target: We create three codebooks ( i .e . three bags of quantized motion patterns ) corresponding to the front , side , and top views .

source: In addition , due to purpose of a stable and unified framework on all benchmark datasets , we cluster extracted motion features to 2000 codewords ( i .e . 2000 quantized motion patterns ) for each codebook .
target: In addition , to ensure a unified framework on all benchmark datasets , we cluster the extracted motion features around 2000 codewords ( i .e . 2000 quantized motion patterns ) for each codebook .

source: The k-means algorithm with Euclidean distance is applied at this step .

source: Quantization and Fusion : Two popular strategies used to quantize extracted features are hard-assignment and soft-assignment .
target: Quantization and Fusion : Two popular strategies for quantizing extracted features are hard-assignment and soft-assignment .

source: To guarantee the efficiency of our framework , we apply the hard-assignment strategy to quantize dense trajectory motion features extracted at step Feature Extraction .

source: With this strategy , each feature vector can be assigned to a codeword using Euclidean distance or rejected as an outlier .

source: A Minimum-Delay Routing Tree Algorithm for Access-Point Communications in Wireless Mesh Networks
target: A Minimum-Delay Routing Tree Algorithm for Access-Point Communications in Wireless Mesh Networks

source: As a scalable , flexible access network to the Internet , we have studied the design optimization and the implementation of the Wireless Internet-access Mesh NETwork ( WIMNET ) .
target: As a scalable , flexible access network to the Internet , we have studied the design optimization and the implementation of the Wireless Internet-access Mesh NETwork ( WIMNET ) .

source: WIMNET is composed of multiple access points ( APs ) that are connected with each other by wireless communications .
target: WIMNET is composed of multiple access points ( APs ) that are connected with each other by wireless communications .

source: At least one AP performs as the gateway ( GW ) to the Internet .
target: At least one AP performs as the gateway ( GW ) to the Internet .

source: Any host in the network can access to the Internet through this GW , after associating its neighbor AP and communicating with multihop wireless links between APs .
target: Any host in the network can access to the Internet through this GW , after associating its neighbor AP and communicating with multihop wireless links between APs .

source: The delay along the routing path degrades the performance of WIMNET .
target: The delay along the routing path degrades the performance of WIMNET .

source: To avoid the bottleneck of communications by minimizing the maximum delay , we formulate the routing tree problem for AP communications , and prove the NP-completeness of its decision version .
target: To avoid the bottleneck of communications by minimizing the maximum delay , we formulate the routing tree problem for AP communications , and prove the NP-completeness of its decision version .

source: Then , we propose the greedy heuristic algorithm of sequentially selecting one link that minimizes the delay of the predicted tree containing the link .
target: Then , we propose the greedy heuristic algorithm of sequentially selecting one link that minimizes the delay of the predicted tree containing the link .

source: The effectiveness of our algorithm is verified through extensive simulations in instances with 25 APs using the WIMNET simulator .
target: The effectiveness of our algorithm is verified through extensive simulations in instances with 25 APs using the WIMNET simulator .

source: Nowadays , the Internet has become widely used in our daily lives with rapid developments of inexpensive small communication devices and high-speed communication technology .
target: Nowadays , the Internet has become widely used in our daily lives with the rapid development of inexpensive small communication devices and high-speed communication technology .

source: A variety of information , data , and services have actually been provided through the Internet .
target: A variety of information , data , and services have actually been provided through the Internet .

source: As a result , a high-speed , flexible , and inexpensive Internet access in every place at any time has been strongly desired among users by using wireless communication devices at mobile hosts such as personal computers ( PCs ) and personal digital assistances ( PDAs ) .
target: As a result , a high-speed , flexible , and inexpensive Internet access has been strongly desired by those who use wireless communication devices at mobile hosts such as personal computers ( PCs ) and personal digital assistances ( PDAs ) .

source: In order to meet these demands , wireless local area networks ( WLANs ) have been widely studied and deployed as the access network to the Internet .
target: In order to meet these demands , wireless local area networks ( WLANs ) have been widely studied and deployed as the access network to the Internet .

source: WLANs have now become available in many private and public spaces including offices , schools , homes , airports , stations , and shopping malls .
target: WLANs have now become available in many private and public spaces including offices , schools , homes , airports , stations , and shopping malls .

source: The wireless mesh network has emerged as a very attractive technology among academics and industries to flexibly and inexpensively realize a large-scale WLAN </CITE> .
target: An emergency technology called the wireless mesh network is considered attractive and praise by academics and industries as a flexible and inexpensice large-scale WLAN </CITE> .

source: The wireless mesh network is composed of multiple wireless routers that are distributed in the network field , so that it can expand the wireless coverage area by a single router that is often limited into a small space .
target: It is composed of multiple wireless routers distributed in the network field , so that it can expand the wireless coverage area by a single router that is often confined to a small space .

source: In the wireless mesh network , data communications between routers are offered by multihop wireless communications , in addition to those between routers and hosts .
target: In the wireless mesh network , data communications between routers are offered by multihop wireless communications , in addition to those between routers and hosts .

source: Among several variations of the wireless mesh network , our study has focused on the network for the Internet access , called the Wireless Internet-access Mesh NETwork ( WIMNET ) for convenience .
target: Among several variations of the wireless mesh network , our study has focused on the network for the Internet access , called the Wireless Internet-access Mesh NETwork ( WIMNET ) for convenience .

source: WIMNET uses only access points ( APs ) as wireless routers , and realizes wireless communications between APs mainly on the MAC layer using the wireless distribution system ( WDS ) </CITE> .
target: WIMNET uses only access points ( APs ) as wireless routers , and realizes wireless communications between APs mainly on the MAC layer using the wireless distribution system ( WDS ) </CITE> .

source: Figure 1 illustrates the overview of WIMNET .
target: Figure 1 illustrates the overview of WIMNET .

source: At least one AP in WIMNET acts as a gateway ( GW ) to the Internet .
target: At least one AP in WIMNET acts as a gateway ( GW ) to the Internet .

source: In WIMNET , each AP takes two different roles for wireless communications , specifically a wireless hub for its associated hosts and a wireless bridge for relaying packets between APs .
target: In WIMNET , each AP takes two different roles for wireless communications , specifically a wireless hub for its associated hosts and a wireless bridge for relaying packets between APs .

source: To reduce the radio interference between these two communications , we use different protocols with different channels ( radio frequencies ) for them .
target: To reduce the radio interference between these two communications , we use different protocols with different channels ( radio frequencies ) for them .

source: Actually , we assign the IEEE 802.11b/g protocol with 2.4GHz for the former role , which is usually available at mobile hosts , and the IEEE 802.11a protocol with 5GHz for the latter one .
target: Actually , we assign the IEEE 802.11b/g protocol with 2.4GHz for the former role , which is usually available at mobile hosts , and the IEEE 802.11a protocol with 5GHz for the latter one .

source: For each protocol , several non-interfered frequency channels are available .
target: For each protocol , several non-interfered frequency channels are available .

source: Using this feature , an AP can use multiple channels by equipped with multiple NICs ( Network Interface Cards ) to increase the bandwidth </CITE> .
target: Using this feature , an AP can use multiple channels by equipped with multiple NICs ( Network Interface Cards ) to increase the bandwidth </CITE> .

source: For the optimal design of WIMNET , we have studied related combinatorial optimization problems and their algorithms .
target: For the optimal design of WIMNET , we have studied related combinatorial optimization problems and their algorithms .

target: In </CITE> , we defined the AP allocation problem with its heuristic algorithms .

source: In </CITE> , we studied the NIC and channel assignment problem .
target: In </CITE> , we studied the NIC and channel assignment problem .

source: As the size of WIMNET is expanded , two factors may determine its performance of communications .
target: As the size of WIMNET is expanded , two factors may determine its performance of communications .

source: The first factor is the increase of the transmission delay at wireless links between GWs and their adjacent APs .
target: The first factor is the increase of the transmission delay at wireless links between GWs and their adjacent APs .

source: In WIMNET , all the packets to/from user hosts associated with APs other than GWs , must be handled by a GW to access the Internet .
target: In WIMNET , all the packets to/from user hosts associated with APs other than GWs must be handled by a GW to access the Internet .

source: Thus , wireless communications around GWs can be very crowded , and one link between GW and its adjacent AP may become the bottleneck of the whole communication in WIMNET .
target: Thus , wireless communications around GWs can be very crowded , and one link between GW and its adjacent AP may become the bottleneck of the whole communication in WIMNET .

source: The second factor is the propagation delay due to multihop communications between an AP and GW .
target: The second factor is the propagation delay due to multihop communications between an AP and GW .

source: The increase of the hop count ( the number of hops ) in the multihop communication directly increases the delay , because packets are transmitted in a bucket brigade way .
target: The increase of the hop count ( the number of hops ) in the multihop communication directly increases the delay , because packets are transmitted in a bucket - brigade manner .

source: It can also increase the transmission delay , because more links need to be activated .
target: It can also increase the transmission delay because more links need to be activated .

source: Therefore , the proper routing for communications between APs to minimize both delays is very important to improve the performance of the large-scale WIMNET .
target: Therefore , the proper routing for communications between APs to minimize both delays is very important to improve the performance of the large-scale WIMNET .

source: The routing paths for AP communications in WIMNET with a single GW becomes a spanning tree rooted at GW of the graph representing the AP network topology , because every AP must be connected with GW for the Internet access .
target: The routing paths for AP communications in WIMNET with a single GW becomes a spanning tree rooted at GW of the graph representing the AP network topology , because every AP must be connected with GW for the Internet access .

source: In this paper , using this graph representation , we formulate the minimum-delay routing tree problem to find optimal routing paths for AP communications in WIMNET .
target: In this paper , using this graph representation , we formulate the minimum-delay routing tree problem to find optimal routing paths for AP communications in WIMNET .

source: We prove the NPcompleteness of the decision version through reduction from the NP-complete bin packing problem </CITE> .
target: We prove the NPcompleteness of the decision version via a reduction from the NP-complete bin packing problem </CITE> .

source: Then , we propose the greedy heuristic algorithm for this problem .
target: Then , we propose the greedy heuristic algorithm for this problem .

source: For the proper routing , the precise estimations of both delays become essential .
target: The precise estimations of both delays are essential for the proper routing .

source: The propagation delay to an AP can be easily estimated by the summation of the link delays along the path between this AP and GW .
target: The propagation delay to an AP can be easily estimated by the summation of the link delays along the path between this AP and GW .

source: However , the estimation of the transmission delay of a link is hard during the tree construction in the greedy algorithm .
target: However , it is hard to estimate the transmission delay of a link during the tree construction in the greedy algorithm .

source: Although this estimation requires the sum of traffics at the link that are transmitted from all the APs along the same path as described later , this path can be known after the routing tree is completed .
target: Although this estimation requires the sum of traffics at the link that are transmitted from all the APs along the same path as described later , this path can be known after the routing tree is completed .

target: Therefore , before selecting one link to construct a routing tree , our algorithm predicts the remaining part of the tree using the Dijkstra shortest path algorithm with link delays , and estimates the transmission delay using the traffics along this predicted path .

target: The effectiveness of our approach is evaluated through simulations using the WIMNET simulator </CITE> that has been developed by our group .

source: Quality Measurement for Transmitted Audio Data Using Distribution of Sub-band Signals

source: Recently , the remarkable progress of network technology has increased the requirement for transmission of high quality multimedia data .

target: By the trend , it has been issued to investigate an efficient methodology for quality measurement of transmitted multimedia data .

source: In this paper , we propose a new audio quality measurement technique to substitute for a typical quality measurement tool , RMSE ( Root Mean Squared Error ) .
target: In this paper , we propose a new audio quality measurement technique to substitute for a typical quality measurement tool , RMSE ( Root Mean Squared Error ) .

source: The proposed method modifies the variance of sub-band signals to perform the estimation of audio quality at the transmitter , the receiver is able to estimate the quality distortion of transmitted audio data by calculating the distance between the variance and the reference value representing the characteristics of sub-band signals , so called EVE ( Estimated Variance Error ) .
target: The proposed method modifies the variance of sub-band signals to perform the estimation of audio quality at the transmitter , the receiver is able to estimate the quality distortion of transmitted audio data by calculating the distance between the variance and the reference value representing the characteristics of sub-band signals , so called EVE ( Estimated Variance Error ) .

source: − Extracting the frequent terms in the document .

target: − Calculating the significance from the co-occurrence frequency of the two terms in a unit of document such as sentence , paragraph … .

source: In this approach , each term appearing in the document , except for stop words such as “ a ” , “ the ” , “ of ” , “ and ” , “ or ” … which contain little information becomes a node in the graph representing the document .
target: In this approach , each term appearing in the document , becomes a node , except for stop words such as “ a ” , “ the ” , “ of ” , “ and ” , and “ or ” which contain little information .
