The direction from one node to another corresponds to the relative positions of the words , and is illustrated by a directed edge starting from the node representing the preceding word .

source: Two-stage Incremental Working Set Selection for Fast Support Vector Training on Large Datasets
target: Two-stage Incremental Working Set Selection for Fast Support Vector Training on Large Datasets

source: We propose iSVM - an incremental algorithm that achieves high speed in training support vector machines ( SVMs ) on large datasets .
target: We propose iSVM - an incremental algorithm that achieves high speed in training support vector machines ( SVMs ) on large datasets .

source: In the common decomposition framework , iSVM starts with a minimum working set ( WS ) , and then iteratively selects one training example to update the WS in each optimization loop .
target: In the common decomposition framework , iSVM starts with a minimum working set ( WS ) , and then iteratively selects one training example to update the WS in each optimization loop .

source: iSVM employs a two-stage strategy in processing the training data .
target: iSVM employs a two-stage strategy in processing the training data .

source: In the first stage , the most prominent vector among randomly sampled data is added to the WS .
target: In the first stage , the most prominent vector among randomly sampled data is added to the WS .

source: This stage results in an approximate SVM solution .
target: This stage results in an approximate SVM solution .

source: The second stage uses temporal solutions to scan through the whole training data once again to find the remaining support vectors ( SVs ) .
target: The second stage uses temporal solutions to scan through the whole training data once again to find the remaining support vectors ( SVs ) .

source: We show that iSVM is especially efficient for training SVMs on applications where data size is much larger than number of SVs .
target: We show that iSVM is especially efficient for training SVMs on applications where data size is much larger than number of SVs .

source: On the KDD-CUP 1999 network intrusion detection dataset with nearly five millions training examples , iSVM takes less than one hour to train an SVM with 94 % testing accuracy , compared to seven hours with LibSVM – one of the state-of-the-art SVM implementations .
target: On the KDD-CUP 1999 network intrusion detection dataset with nearly five millions training examples , iSVM takes less than one hour to train an SVM with 94 % testing accuracy , compared to seven hours with LibSVM – one of the state-of-the-art SVM implementations .

source: We also provide analysis and experimental comparisons between iSVM and the related algorithms .
target: We also provide analysis and experimental comparisons between iSVM and the related algorithms .

source: In recent years support vector machine ( SVM ) \CITE has been successfully applied in various machine learning applications .
target: In recent years support vector machine ( SVM ) \CITE has been successfully applied in various machine learning applications .

source: However , scalability still remains one of biggest challenges for SVM in particular and kernel-based methods in general .
target: However , scalability still remains one of biggest challenges for SVM in particular and kernel-based methods in general .

source: It is due to the fact that training an SVM requires solving a quadratic programming ( QP ) problem in which , for the worst case , the complexity becomes </Eq> for time and </Eq> for memory requirement , where l is the number of training examples \CITE .
target: It is due to the fact that training an SVM requires solving a quadratic programming ( QP ) problem in which , for the worst case , the complexity becomes </Eq> for time and </Eq> for memory requirement , where l is the number of training examples \CITE .

source: There have been number of approaches to scalability problem of SVM training .
target: There have been a number of approaches to scalability problem of SVM training .

source: Among them decomposition is the most widely implemented method in various SVM software and libraries , e.g . LibSVM \CITE , SVM light \CITE , CoreSVM \CITE , HeroSVM \CITE , and SimpleSVM \CITE .
target: Among them , decomposition is the most widely implemented method in various SVM software and libraries , e.g . LibSVM \CITE , SVM light \CITE , CoreSVM \CITE , HeroSVM \CITE , and SimpleSVM \CITE .

source: The main idea of decomposition algorithms is to divide training data into two sets : an active working set ( WS ) whose coefficients can be updated , and an inactive set whose coefficients are temporally fixed \CITE .
target: The main idea of decomposition algorithms is to divide training data into two sets : an active working set ( WS ) whose coefficients can be updated , and an inactive set whose coefficients are temporally fixed \CITE .

source: The extreme case of this decomposition approach is the Sequential Minimal Optimization ( SMO ) algorithm \CITE that does optimization on a set of only two examples .
target: The extreme case of this decomposition approach is the Sequential Minimal Optimization ( SMO ) algorithm \CITE that does optimization on a set of only two examples .

source: For each optimization loop , SMO scans through the whole training data to find a good pair of vectors , and then updates coefficients of the two selected vectors analytically .
target: For each optimization loop , SMO scans through the whole training data to find a good pair of vectors , and then updates coefficients of the two selected vectors analytically .

source: In order to find a good pair in the next iteration , it is required to update the violation of optimality criteria of all training vectors .
target: In order to find a good pair in the next iteration , it is required to update the violation of optimality criteria of all training vectors .

source: It is very expensive for applications where the number of updates ( training data ) is huge .
target: It is very expensive for applications where the number of updates ( training data ) is huge .

source: In this paper , we introduce a two-stage incremental WS selection method in training SVMs .
target: In this paper , we introduce a two-stage incremental WS selection method in training SVMs .

source: The proposed algorithm starts from finding an initial SVM solution on a minimum WS ( two vectors from opposite classes in a two-class classification task ) .
target: The proposed algorithm starts from finding an initial SVM solution on a minimum WS ( two vectors from opposite classes in a two-class classification task ) .

source: It then iteratively selects one training vector to update the WS .
target: It then iteratively selects one training vector to update the WS .

source: The selection of new vectors is divided into two stages .
target: The selection of new vectors is divided into two stages .

source: In the first stage , only the most prominent vector among a fixed number of sampling data is added to the WS while all others remain in the training data .
target: In the first stage , only the most prominent vector among a fixed number of sampling data is added to the WS while all others remain in the training data .

source: From the second stage , all training examples are checked once again .
target: From the second stage , all training examples are checked once again .

source: For both stages , each optimality violated vector is used to update the WS and find a new SVM solution .
target: For both stages , each optimality violated vector is used to update the WS and find a new SVM solution .

source: We show that with this two-stage WS selection strategy the proposed iSVM has a linear time complexity in number of training examples and cubic in number of SVs .
target: We show that with this two-stage WS selection strategy , the proposed iSVM has a linear time complexity in number of training examples and cubic in number of SVs .

source: Experiments on large benchmark datasets show that iSVM is very fast when working on applications where number of SVs is much smaller than number of training data .
target: Experiments on large benchmark datasets show that iSVM is very fast when working on applications where number of SVs is much smaller than number of training data .

source: On the KDD-CUP 1999 network intrusion detection dataset with nearly five millions training examples iSVM takes less than one hour to train a SVM with 94 % testing accuracy .
target: On the KDD-CUP 1999 network intrusion detection dataset with nearly five millions training examples , iSVM takes less than one hour to train a SVM with 94 % testing accuracy .

source: With LibSVM \CITE – one of the state-of-the-art SMO implementations , it takes seven hours .
target: With LibSVM \CITE – one of the state-of-the-art SMO implementations , it takes seven hours .

source: Requirements Engineering in a Model-based Methodology for Embedded Automotive Software
target: Requirements Engineering in a Model-based Methodology for Embedded Automotive Software

source: This paper resumes the requirements engineering in a model-based methodology for embedded automotive software .
target: This paper examines the requirements engineering in a model-based methodology for embedded automotive software .

source: The methodology relies on two standard languages : EAST-ADL for automotive architecture description and SysML for systems modeling .
target: The methodology relies on two standard languages : EAST-ADL for automotive architecture description and SysML for systems modeling .

source: The requirements engineering in the methodology describes phases of elicitation , modeling , traceability , verification and validation .
target: The requirements engineering in the methodology describes phases of elicitation , modeling , traceability , verification and validation .

source: It is illustrated by applying on a case study – the knock controller – a part of the engine management system .
target: It is illustrated by applying in a case study of the knock controller – a part of the engine management system .

source: Modern car is now equipped with more and more functionalities dependent on embedded electronics , ranging from powertrain and chassis control to body comfort and infotainment .
target: Modern car is now equipped with more and more functionalities dependent on embedded electronics , ranging from powertrain and chassis control to body comfort and infotainment .

source: These functionalities are distributed over a networked Electronic Control Units ( ECU ) .
target: These functionalities are distributed over a networked Electronic Control Units ( ECU ) .

source: The size and complexity of software for these embedded electronics increase rapidly with its cost raising from 10 % of the overall cost in 1970 to 40 % in 2010 .
target: The size and complexity of software for these embedded electronics increase rapidly with its cost rising from 10 % of the overall cost in 1970 to 40 % in 2010 .

source: Actually , 90 % of innovations in the automotive industry concerns embedded electronics and 80 % among them are software \CITE .
target: Actually , 90 % of innovations in the automotive industry concern embedded electronics and 80 % among them are software \CITE .

source: A big challenge in developing automotive software concerns the quality .
target: A big challenge in developing automotive software concerns its quality .

source: Automotive system are safety-critical systems where failures may cause severe damages or loss , so software errors led directly to car recalls .
target: Automotive systems are safety-critical systems whose failures may cause severe damage or loss , so software errors led directly to car recalls .

source: According to the report \CITE , one-third of the recalls in recent year is caused by software errors .
target: According to the report \CITE , one-third of the recalls in recent years are caused by software errors .

source: More efforts are needed on software ’s verification and testing .
target: More effort is needed on software ’s verification and testing .

source: Another challenge concerns the reduction the time of development .
target: Another challenge concerns the reduction the development time .

source: The automotive market is shared by manufacturers , suppliers and tool vendors , and all needs shorten processes which favor the exchangeability among them and the reuse of software in different product lines .
target: The automotive market is shared by manufacturers , suppliers and tool vendors , and all need shorten processes which favor the exchangeability among them and the reuse of software in different product lines .

source: They also need to follow requirements along the development , from the specification to design and code , to anticipate and communicate its changes throughout teams .
target: They also need to follow requirements along the development , from the specification to the design and the code , to anticipate and communicate its changes throughout the team .

source: New paradigm in software development is born in this context to face these challenges .
target: A new paradigm software development is formed in this context to face these challenges .

source: In Europe , automotive actors tried to cooperate on a common base for software development .
target: In Europe , automotive actors cooperated to establish mutual communication standardized for software development .

source: The result of this corporation is EAST-ADL \CITE , a recently defined standard .
target: The recent result of this corporation is EAST-ADL \CITE

source: EAST-ADL is an architecture description language dedicated to automotive software .
target: an architecture description language dedicated to automotive software .

source: It provides a mean to describe the functionality of a vehicle , from high level requirement to implementation details .
target: It provides a means to describe the functionality of a vehicle , from high level requirements to implementation details .

source: It focuses on structural aspect , leaving behavioral aspect for existing tools . EASTADL is based on Unified Modeling Language 2 \CITE but has automotive-specific constructs and semantics in order to make system models unambiguous , consistent and exchangeable .
target: It focuses on structural aspects , leaving behavioral aspects for existing tools . EASTADL is based on Unified Modeling Language 2 \CITE but has automotive-specific constructs and semantics in order to make system models unambiguous , consistent and exchangeable .

source: Model-based development ( MBD ) is a preferred approach for automotive software because it improves the specification , design , and implementation phases .
target: Model-based development ( MBD ) is a preferred approach for automotive software because it improves the specification , design , and implementation phases .

source: MBD benefits from the Systems Modeling Language ( SysML ) \CITE , another recently defined by Object Management Group ( OMG ) .
target: MBD benefits from the Systems Modeling Language ( SysML ) \CITE , another recently defined by Object Management Group ( OMG ) .

source: SysML gives a means to early represent into models the requirements and physical parametric of automotive systems .
target: SysML is used to model the requirements and physical parameters of automotive systems .

source: SysML has also the capacities of facilitate the design and verification .
target: SysML has also the capacities of facilitating the design and verification .

source: The research project MeMVaTEx \CITE addresses a modelbased methodology that emphasizes the requirements validation and traceability .
target: MeMVaTEx research project \CITE develops a modelbased methodology that emphasizes the requirements validation and traceability .

source: The methodology invests two languages : EAST-ADL for automotive architecture description and SysML for system modeling .
target: The methodology investigates two languages : EAST-ADL for automotive architecture description and SysML for system modeling .

source: The methodology describes step-by-step process with appropriate tools supporting each step .
target: The methodology describes a step-by-step process with appropriate tools supporting each step .

source: It aims to give a seamless solution for industrial use .
target: It aims to give a seamless solution for industrial use .

source: An automotive case study – the engine knock controller – a part of the Engine Management System ( EMS ) is used to illustrated the methodology .
target: An automotive case study shows that the engine knock controller – a part of the Engine Management System ( EMS ) - is used to illustrated the methodology .

source: This paper shows the requirements engineering in the methodology .
target: This paper shows the requirements engineering in the methodology .

source: It describes phases of elicitation , modeling and traceability , verification and validation , and accompanied tools .
target: It describes phases of elicitation , modeling and traceability , verification and validation , and accompanied tools .

source: In a four-stroke gasoline engine , air and vaporized fuel are drawn in in the first stroke ( intake ) .
target: In a four-stroke gasoline engine , air and vaporized fuel are drawn in in the first stroke ( intake ) .

source: In the second stroke , fuel vapor and air are compressed and ignited ( compression ) .
target: In the second stroke , fuel vapor and air are compressed and ignited ( compression ) .

source: Fuel combusts and piston is pushed downwards in the third stroke ( combustion ) and exhaust is driven out in the last stroke ( exhaust ) .
target: Fuel combusts and piston is pushed downwards in the third stroke ( combustion ) and exhaust is driven out in the last stroke ( exhaust ) .

source: In practice , ignition usually occurs before the end of the second stroke in order to maximizing power and fuel economy and minimize exhaust emission .
target: In practice , ignition usually occurs before the end of the second stroke in order to maximize power fuel economy and minimize exhaust emission .

source: Under some circumstances , when the temperature and pressure of the unburned air/fuel mixture exceeds a critical level , a second auto-ignition occurs as shown in the right of the Figure 4 .
target: When the temperature and pressure of the unburned air/fuel mixture exceeds a critical level , a second auto-ignition occurs as shown in the right picture in Figure 4 .

source: The two-flame crossing produces a shock wave with rapid increase in cylinder pressure .
target: The two-flame crossing produces a shock wave with rapid increase in cylinder pressure .

source: The impulse caused by the shock wave excites a resonance in the cylinder at a characteristic frequency .
target: The impulse caused by the shock wave excites a resonance in the cylinder at a characteristic frequency .

source: Damages to piston , ring , and exhaust valves can result if sustained heavy knock occurs .
target: Damages to piston , ring , and exhaust valves could ensue if sustained heavy knock occurs .

source: An appropriate anti-knock control , represented in Figure 5 , is applied to each cylinder at every engine cycle from low engine speed up to the highest engine speed .
target: An appropriate anti-knock control , represented in Figure 5 , is applied to each cylinder at every engine cycle at any predetermined speed .

source: A knock control system consists of one or several noise sensors , and a controller which acquire the noise through the sensors , and computes the correction during the combustion phases of the cylinders .
target: A knock control system consists of noise sensors that monitor the noise level , and a controller that computers corrections based on the feeback from noise sensors during the in-cylinder combustion process .

source: The controller can detect knocks using spectral analysis techniques \CITE . The controller decide to advance or retard the ignition to correct .
target: Spectral analysis techniques are used to allow the engine controller \CITE to detect knocks and advance or retard the ignition .

source: Incorporating Statistical Background Model and Joint Probabilistic Data Association Filter into Motorcycle Tracking
target: Incorporating Statistical Background Model and Joint Probabilistic Data Association Filter into Motorcycle Tracking

source: Multi - target tracking is an attractive research field due to its widespread application areas and challenges .
target: Multi - target tracking is an attractive research field due to its widespread application areas and challenges .

source: Every point tracking method includes two mechanisms : object detection and data association .
target: Every point tracking method includes two mechanisms : object detection and data association .

source: This paper is a combination between a statistical background modeling method for foreground object detection and Joint Probabilistic Data Association filter ( JPDAF ) in the context of motorcycle tracking .
target: This paper is a combination between a statistical background modeling method for foreground object detection and Joint Probabilistic Data Association filter ( JPDAF ) in the context of motorcycle tracking .

source: A major limitation of JPDAF is its inability to adapt to changes in the number of targets , but in this work , it is modified so that we can successfully apply JPDAF with known number of targets at each time instant .
target: A major limitation of JPDAF is its inability to adapt to changes in the number of targets , but in this work , it is modified so that we can successfully apply JPDAF with known number of targets at each time instant .

source: The experimental system works well with the number of targets less than 10 / frame and be able to self-evolve with gradual and " once-off " background changes .
target: The experimental system works well with the number of targets less than 10 / frame and be able to self-evolve with gradual and " once-off " background changes .

source: Motion understanding is an essential function of human vision .
target: Motion understanding is an essential function of human vision .

source: Consequently , object tracking takes the crucial role in computer vision .
target: Consequently , object tracking takes the crucial role in computer vision .

source: Multi - target tracking has widespread applications in both military ( air defense , air traffic control , ocean surveillance ) and civilian areas ( for automatical surveillance demands in public or secret places ) , especially when human labour becomes more and more expensive .
target: Multi - target tracking has widespread applications in both military ( air defense , air traffic control , ocean surveillance ) and civilian areas ( for automatical surveillance demands in public or secret places ) , especially when human labour becomes more and more expensive .

source: Object tracking , in general , is a challenging problem .
target: Object tracking , in general , is a challenging problem .

source: Its complexities arise due to the following factors : loss of information caused by projection from 3D to 2D space , complex object motions , complex object shapes , partial and full object occlusions , scene illumination changes , and realtime processing requirements .
target: Its complexities arise due to the following factors : loss of information caused by projection from 3D to 2D space , complex object motions , complex object shapes , partial and full object occlusions , scene illumination changes , and realtime processing requirements .

source: There are three main categories of object tracking </CITE> : point tracking , kernel tracking , and silhouette tracking .
target: There are three main categories of object tracking </CITE> : point tracking , kernel tracking , and silhouette tracking .

source: While kernel and silhouette tracking concern object shapes , point tracking considers an object as a
target: While kernel and silhouette tracking concern object shapes , point tracking considers an object as a

source: point and just focuses on its position and motion , which can be represented by state vector .
target: point and just focuses on its position and motion , which can be represented by state vector .

source: Filtering is a class of methods that is suited for solving the dynamic state estimation problems of point tracking .
target: Filtering is a class of methods that is suited for solving the dynamic state estimation problems of point tracking .

source: In multi-target tracking , we have a task of finding a correspondence between the current targets and measurements , named data association .
target: In multi-target tracking , we have a task of finding a correspondence between the current targets and measurements , named data association .

source: Data association is a complicated problem especially in the presence of occlusions , misdetections , entries , and exits of objects .
target: Data association is a complicated problem especially in the presence of occlusions , misdetections , entries , and exits of objects .

source: There are many statistical techniques for data association </CITE> , among them , Joint Probabilistic Data Association ( JPDA ) is the method that aims to find a correspondence between measurements and objects at the current time step based on enumerating all possible associations and computing the association probabilities , it is a widely used technique for data association ( </CITE> , </CITE> ) .
target: There are many statistical techniques for data association </CITE> , among them , Joint Probabilistic Data Association ( JPDA ) is the method that aims to find a correspondence between measurements and objects at the current time step based on enumerating all possible associations and computing the association probabilities . It is a widely used technique for data association ( </CITE> , </CITE> ) .

source: However , to have a good JPDA filter ( JPDAF ) , it is required to have accurate measurements , that means we need to have good object detection results .
target: However , to have a good JPDA filter ( JPDAF ) , it is required to have accurate measurements . That means we need to have good object detection results .

source: Every tracking method requires an object detection mechanism , there are those which just need the detection at the first time objects appear , while the others need it in every frame , point tracking belongs to this type .
target: Every tracking method requires an object detection mechanism . There are those which just need the detection at the first time objects appear , while the others need it in every frame . Point tracking belongs to this type .

source: One effective way for foreground object detection is to give an accurate background model .
target: One effective way for foreground object detection is to give an accurate background model .

source: Recently , L . Li et al proposed a foreground object detection method by statistical modeling of complex backgrounds </CITE> .
target: Recently , L . Li et al proposed a foreground object detection method by statistical modeling of complex backgrounds </CITE> .

source: This work used a Bayesian framework for incorporating three type of features : spectral , spatial and temporal features into a representation of complex background containing both stationary and nonstationary objects .
target: This work used a Bayesian framework for incorporating three types of features , i .e . , spatial and temporal features into a representation of complex background containing both stationary and nonstationary objects .

source: With the statistics of background features , the method is able to : represent the appearances of both static and dynamic background pixels , self-evolve to gradual as well as sudden " once - off " background changes .
target: With the statistics of background features , the method is able to represent the appearances of both static and dynamic background pixels and self - evolve to gradual as well as sudden " once - off " background changes .

source: Taking advantage of the excellent object detection results from this method , this paper employs JPDAF for vehicle tracking in the motorcycle lane .
target: Taking advantage of the excellent object detection results from this method , this paper employs JPDAF for vehicle tracking in the motorcycle lane .

source: A major limitation of JPDAF is its inability to adapt to changes in the number of targets , because it is confused between a measurement originated from a new object appearance and a false alarm .
target: A major limitation of JPDAF is its inability to adapt to changes in the number of targets , because it is confused between a measurement originated from a new object appearance and a false alarm .

source: However , in the context of motorcycle surveillance , we has proposed a strategy to detect new objects entering and objects leaving the observation area , so that we can successfully apply JPDAF with known number of targets at each time instant .
target: However , in the context of motorcycle surveillance , we has proposed a strategy to detect new objects entering and objects leaving the observation area , so that we can successfully apply JPDAF with known number of targets at each time instant .

source: The experimental system has good results with the number of targets less than 10 / frame , including of detecting and tracking the wrong-wayed motorcycles .
target: The experimental system has good results with the number of targets less than 10 / frame , including results detecting and tracking the wrong-wayed motorcycles .

source: Motorcycle tracking in particular and traffic tracking in generral , is an interesting but challenging application .
target: Motorcycle tracking in particular and traffic tracking in generral is an interesting but challenging application .

source: Its main difficulties can be enumerated as : the severely occlusions when traffic density is high ( especially in rush hours ) , the shadows of big vehicles , and the real-time processing demand of a traffic surveillance system .
target: Its main difficulties can be enumerated as the severely occlusions when traffic density is high ( especially in rush hours ) , the shadows of big vehicles , and the real-time processing demand of a traffic surveillance system .

source: This paper is the next step ( after </CITE> ) of the effort finding the most satisfied approach for automatical traffic surveillance in big cities of Vietnam .
target: This paper is the next step ( after </CITE> ) to find the most satisfying approach for automatical traffic surveillance in big cities of Vietnam .

source: The remains of this paper is organized as follow : section II is the main ideas for statistical modeling of complex background proposed in </CITE> , section III reviews the background of JPDAF , a complete algorithm and experimented results on simulated data of JPDAF are presented at the end of this section , section IV is the combination of statistical background model and the modified JPDAF so that they can be applied in the motorcycle tracking situation , the experimental results of this combination are submitted in section V , and the conclusion is after all others .
target: The rest of this paper is organized as Section II is the main ideas for statistical modeling of complex background proposed in </CITE> . Section III reviews the background of JPDAF , a complete algorithm and experimented results on simulated data of JPDAF are presented at the end of this section , section IV is the combination of statistical background model and the modified JPDAF so that they can be applied in the motorcycle tracking situation . The experimental results of this combination are submitted in section V , and section VI presents our conclusion .

target: Syntactically annotated corpora have become important resources for natural language processing , due in part to the success of corpus-based methods .

source: Since words are often considered as the primitive units of language structures , the annotation of word segmentation forms the basis of these corpora .
target: Since words are often considered as primitive units of language structures , the annotation of word segmentation forms the basis of these corpora .

source: This is also a concern of Vietnamese Treebank ( VTB ) , the first and the only publicly available syntactically annotated corpus so far for the Vietnamese language .
target: This is also a concern for the Vietnamese Treebank ( VTB ) , which is the first and only publicly available syntactically annotated corpus thus far for the Vietnamese language .

source: Although word segmentation is straight-forward for space-delimited languages like English , this is not true for languages like Vietnamese of which no standard criterion for word segmentation exists .
target: Although word segmentation is straight-forward for space-delimited languages like English , this is not the case for languages like Vietnamese for which a standard criterion for word segmentation does not exist .

source: This work explores the challenges of Vietnamese word segmentation through the detection and correction of inconsistency for VTB .
target: This work explores the challenges of Vietnamese word segmentation through the detection and correction of inconsistency for VTB .

source: Then , by combining and splitting the inconsistent annotations detected , we could observe the influence of different word segmentation criteria on automatic word segmentation , and the applications of word segmentation , including text classification and English-Vietnamese statistical machine translation .
target: Then , by combining and splitting the inconsistent annotations that were detected , we are able to observe the influence of different word segmentation criteria on automatic word segmentation , and the applications of word segmentation , including text classification and English-Vietnamese statistical machine translation .

source: The analysis and experimental results showed that our methods improved the quality of VTB , which positively affected the performance of its applications .
target: The analysis and experimental results showed that our methods improved the quality of VTB , which positively affected the performance of its applications .

source: Treebanks , corpora annotated with syntactic structures , have become more and more important for language processing .
target: Treebanks , which are corpora annotated with syntactic structures , have become more and more important for language processing .

source: To strengthen the automatic processing of the Vietnamese language , the Vietnamese treebank ( VTB ) has been built as a part of the national project , " Vietnamese language and speech processing ( VLSP ) " ( Nguyen et al . , 2009b ) .
target: In order to strengthen the automatic processing of the Vietnamese language , the Vietnamese Treebank ( VTB ) has been built as a part of the national project , " Vietnamese language and speech processing ( VLSP ) " ( Nguyen et al . , 2009b ) .

source: However , in our preliminary experiment with VTB , when we trained the Berkeley parser ( Petrov et al . , 2006 ) and evaluated it using the corpus , the parser achieved only 65.8 % in F-score .
target: However , in our preliminary experiment with VTB , when we trained the Berkeley parser ( Petrov et al . , 2006 ) and evaluated it by using the corpus , the parser achieved only 65.8 % in F-score .

source: This performance is far lower than the state-of-the-art performance reported for Berkeley Parser on English Penn Treebank , 90.3 % in F-score ( Petrov et al . , 2006 ) .
target: This score is far lower than the state-of-the-art performance reported for the Berkeley Parser on the English Penn Treebank , which reported 90.3 % in F-score ( Petrov et al . , 2006 ) .

source: There are two possible reasons for this .
target: There are two possible reasons to explain this outcome .

source: First , the quality of VTB is not good enough to build a good a parser , including the quality of the annotation scheme , the annotation guidelines , and the annotation process .
target: One reason for this outcome is the quality of VTB , including the quality of the annotation scheme , the annotation guidelines , and the annotation process .

source: Second , parsing Vietnamese is a difficult problem by its own ; and we need to seek new solutions to the problem .
target: The second reason is the difficulty of parsing Vietnamese ; we need to seek new solutions to address this problem .

source: VTB is annotated with three layers : word segmentation , POS tagging , and bracketing .
target: VTB is annotated with three layers : word segmentation , POS tagging , and bracketing .

source: This paper focuses on the word segmentation issues since the most basic unit of a Treebank is word ( Di Sciullo and Edwin , 1987 ) , and defining “ What are words ? “ is the first problem that a treebank has to solve ( Xia , 2000b ,a ; Sornlertlamvanich et al . , 1997 , 1999 ) .
target: This paper focuses on the word segmentation , since the most basic unit of a treebank are words ( Di Sciullo and Edwin , 1987 ) , and defining " words " is the first step ( Xia , 2000b ,a ; Sornlertlamvanich et al . , 1997 , 1999 ) .

source: For languages like English , answering this question is almost trivial , because the blank spaces denote word delimiters .
target: For languages like English , defining " words " is almost trivial , because the blank spaces denote word delimiters .

source: However , for an isolating language like Vietnamese , where blank spaces play a role of syllable delimiters , " What are words ? " is not a trivial question .
target: However , for an isolating language like Vietnamese , for which blank spaces play a role of syllable delimiters , " What are words ? " is not a trivial question .

source: For example , the sentence " Học sinh học sinh học ( students learn biology ) </CITE> " is composed of three words , " học sinh ( student ) " , " học ( learn ) , " and " sinh học ( biology ) " .
target: For example , the sentence " Học sinh học sinh học ( students learn biology ) </CITE> " is composed of three words , " học sinh ( student ) " , " học ( learn ) , " and " sinh học ( biology ) " .

source: Word segmentation is expected to break down the sentence at the boundaries of these words , not to split " học sinh ( student ) " and " sinh học ( biology ) . "
target: Word segmentation is expected to break down the sentence at the boundaries of these words , instead of splitting " học sinh ( student ) " and " sinh học ( biology ) . "

source: Note that the terminology " word segmentation " also refers to the task of extracting words statistically without concerning a gold-standard for segmentation , as in ( Ha , 2003 ; Le et al . , 2010 ) .
target: Note that the terminology " word segmentation " also refers to the task of extracting words statistically without concerning a gold-standard for segmentation , as in ( Ha , 2003 ; Le et al . , 2010 ) .

source: In such context , the extracted words are more appropriate for building a dictionary than for corpus-based language processing , which are out of the focus of this paper .
target: In such a context , the extracted words are more appropriate for building a dictionary , rather than for corpus-based language processing , which are outside of the scope of this paper .

source: Establishing a gold standard for Vietnamese word segmentation faces some difficulties coming from the characteristics of the language .
target: Because of the discussed characteristics of the language , there are challenges in establishing a gold standard for Vietnamese word segmentation .

source: The difficulties of Vietnamese word segmentation have been recognized by many researchers ( Ha , 2003 ; Nguyen et al . , 2004 , 2006 ; Le et al . , 2010 ) .
target: The difficulties in Vietnamese word segmentation have been recognized by many researchers ( Ha , 2003 ; Nguyen et al . , 2004 , 2006 ; Le et al . , 2010 ) .

source: Although most people agree that the Vietnamese language has two types of words : single and compound , there is little consensus on how to segment a sentence into words .
target: Although most people agree that the Vietnamese language has two types of words : single and compound , there is little consensus as to the methodology for segmenting a sentence into words .

source: The disagreement is not only because of the different functions of blank spaces as mentioned above but also because Vietnamese is not an inflectional language like English or Japanese where morphological forms can be useful clues for word segmentation .
target: The disagreement occurs not only because of the different functions of blank spaces ( as mentioned above ) , but also because Vietnamese is not an inflectional language , as is the case for English or Japanese , for which morphological forms can provide useful clues for word segmentation .

source: While the similar problems also happen with Chinese word segmentation ( Xia , 2000b ) , Vietnamese word segmentation may be more difficult because the modern Vietnamese writing system is based on Latin characters , which represents the pronunciation , but not the meaning of words .
target: While similar problems also occur with Chinese word segmentation ( Xia , 2000b ) , Vietnamese word segmentation may be more difficult , because the modern Vietnamese writing system is based on Latin characters , which represent the pronunciation , but not the meaning of words .

source: All these characteristics make it diﬃcult to perform word segmentation for Vietnamese both manually and automatically , and have resulted in different criteria for word segmenation .
target: All of these characteristics make it diﬃcult to perform word segmentation for Vietnamese , both manually and automatically , and have thus resulted in different criteria for word segmentation .

source: However , so far , there have been few studies on the challenges in word segmentation , and the comparison of different word segmentation criteria .
target: However , so far , there have been few studies on the challenges in word segmentation , and the comparison of different word segmentation criteria .

source: In this paper , a brief introduction of the Vietnamese treebank VTB and its annotation scheme are given in Section 2 .
target: In this paper , a brief introduction of the Vietnamese Treebank VTB and its annotation scheme are provided in Section 2 .

source: Then , we described our methods for the detection and correction of the problematic annotations in the VTB corpus ( Section 4.2 ) .
target: Then , we described our methods for the detection and correction of the problematic annotations in the VTB corpus ( Section 4.2 ) .

source: We classified the problematic annotations into several patterns of inconsistency , part of which were manually fixed to improve the quality of the corpus .
target: We classified the problematic annotations into several patterns of inconsistency , part of which were manually fixed to improve the quality of the corpus .

source: The rest , which can be considered as the most difficult and controversial casess of word segmentation , were used to create different versions of the VTB corpus , representing different word segmentation criteria .
target: The rest , which can be considered as the most difficult and controversial instances of word segmentation , were used to create different versions of the VTB corpus , representing different word segmentation criteria .

source: Finally , we evaluated these criteria in automatic word segmentation , and its application in text classification and English-Vietnamese statistical machine translation , in Section 4 .
target: Finally , we evaluated these criteria in automatic word segmentation , and its application in text classification and English-Vietnamese statistical machine translation , in Section 4 .

source: This study is not only beneficial for the development of computational processing technologies for Vietnamese , a language spoken by over 90 million people , but also for the similar languages such as Thai , Laos , and so on .
target: This study is not only beneficial for the development of computational processing technologies for Vietnamese , a language spoken by over 90 million people , but also for similar languages such as Thai , Laos , and so on .

source: This study also promotes the computational linguistic studies on how to transfer methods developed for a popular language , like English , to a language that has not yet intensively studied .
target: This study also promotes the computational linguistic studies on how to transfer methods developed for a popular language , like English , to a language that has not yet been intensively studied .

source: Word segmentation in VTB aims to found a standard for word segmentation in a context of multi-level language processing .
target: Word segmentation in VTB aims at establishing a standard for word segmentation in a context of multi-level language processing .

source: VTB specifies 12 types of units that should be identified as words ( Table 1 ) ( Nguyen et al . , a ) , which can be divided into three groups : single , compound , and special " words . "
target: VTB specifies 12 types of units that should be identified as words ( Table 1 ) ( Nguyen et al . , a ) , which can be divided up into three groups : single , compound , and special " words . "

source: Single words contain only one token .
target: Single words contain only one token .

source: The terminology tokens refers to text spans separated with each other by blank spaces .
target: The terminology tokens refers to text spans that are separated from each other by blank spaces .

source: Compound words have two or more tokens , and are divided into four types : compound words composed by semantic coordination ( semantic-coordinated compound ) , compound words composed by semantic subordination ( semantic-subordinated compound ) , compound words with aﬃx , and reduplicated words .
target: Compound words have two or more tokens , and are divided into four types : compound words composed by semantic coordination ( semantic-coordinated compound ) , compound words composed by semantic subordination ( semantic-subordinated compound ) , compound words with an aﬃx , and reduplicated words .

source: Special " words " can be idioms , locutions , proper names , date times , numbers , symbols , sentence marks , foreign words , or abbreviations .
target: Special " words " include idioms , locutions , proper names , date times , numbers , symbols , sentence marks , foreign words , or abbreviations .

source: The segmentation of these types of words forms a basis for the POS tagging , with 18 different POS tags shown in Table 2 ( Nguyen et al . , c ) .
target: The segmentation of these types of words forms a basis for the POS tagging , with 18 different POS tags , as shown in Table 2 ( Nguyen et al . , c ) .

source: Each unit in Table 1 goes with several example words of which English translations are given in parentheses .
target: Each unit in Table 1 goes with several example words ; English translations are provided in parentheses .

source: Besides , we added a translation for each token , when possible , so that the readers unfamiliar with Vietnamese can have an intuitive idea of how the compound words are formed .
target: Furthermore , we added a translation for each token , where possible , so that readers who are unfamiliar with Vietnamese can have an intuitive idea as to how the compound words are formed .

source: The subscript of a token translation is the index of that token in the compound word .
target: The subscript of a token translation is the index of that token in the compound word .

source: However , for some tokens , we could not find any appropriate English translation , so we give it an empty translation , marked with an asterisk .
target: However , for some tokens , we could not find any appropriate English translation , so we gave it an empty translation , marked with an asterisk .

source: Note that a Vietnamese word or a token in context can have other meanings , in addition to the given translations .
target: Note that a Vietnamese word or a token in context can have other meanings , in addition to the given translations .

source: A special type of words in Vietnamese is noun , denoted by the part-of-speech Nc in Table 2 .
target: A classifier noun , denoted by the part-of-speech Nc in Table 2 , is a special type of word in Vietnamese .

source: Classifier nouns are specific to several Southeast Asian languages , like Vietnamese and Thai .
target: Classifier nouns are specific to several Southeast Asian languages , like Vietnamese and Thai .

source: One of the functions of classifier nouns is to express the definiteness .
target: One of the functions of classifier nouns is to express the definiteness .

source: For example , the common noun " bàn " means tables in general , while " cái bàn " means a specific table , similar to the table in English .
target: For example , the common noun " bàn " generally means tables , while " cái bàn " means a specific table , similar to the table in English .

source: In this section , we analyzed the VTB corpus to know whether the difficulties in Vietnamese word segmentation a ff ected the quality of VTB annotations .
target: In this section , we analyzed the VTB corpus to determine whether the difficulties in Vietnamese word segmentation affected the quality of VTB annotations .

source: The analysis results revealed several types of inconsistent annotations , which are also the most problematic cases of Vietnamese word segmentation .
target: The analysis revealed several types of inconsistent annotations , which are also problematic for Vietnamese word segmentation .

source: Our analysis is based on two types of inconsistency : variation and structural inconsistency , whose definitions and details are given below .
target: Our analysis is based on two types of inconsistencies : variation and structural inconsistency , which are defined below .

source: Variation inconsistency : is a sequence of tokens , which has more than one way of segmentation in the corpus .
target: Variation inconsistency : is a sequence of tokens , which has more than one way of segmentation in the corpus .

source: For example , " con gái/girl " can remain as one word , or be segmented into two words , " con " and " gái " .
target: For example , " con gái/girl " can remain as one word , or be segmented into two words , " con " and " gái " .

source: A variation can be an annotation inconsistency , or an ambiguity in Vietnamese .
target: A variation can be an annotation inconsistency , or an ambiguity in Vietnamese .

source: While ambiguity cases reflect the difficulty of the language , annotation inconsistencies are usually caused by the confusion in the decision of annotators , which should be eliminated in annotation .
target: While ambiguity cases reflect the difficulty of the language , annotation inconsistencies are usually caused by the confusion in the decision of annotators , which should be eliminated in annotation .

source: We use the term variation instance to refer a single occurrence of a variation .
target: We use the term variation instance to refer to a single occurrence of a variation .

source: Structural inconsistency : happens when di ff erent sequences have similar structures , thus should be splitted in the same way , but are segmented in different ways in the corpus .
target: Structural inconsistency : happens when different sequences have similar structures , and thus should be split in the same way , but are segmented in different ways in the corpus .

source: For example , " con gái/girl " and " con trai/boy " have similar structures : a combination of a classifier noun and a common noun , Nc + N , so when " con gái/girl " is splitted , and " con trai/boy " is not , it is considered as a structural inconsistency of Nc .
target: For example , " con gái/girl " and " con trai/boy " have similar structures : a combination of a classifier noun and a common noun , Nc + N , so when " con gái/girl " is split , and " con trai/boy " is not , it is considered as a structural inconsistency of Nc .

source: It is likely that structural inconsistency in word segmentation level makes the higher levels of processing , POS tagging and bracketing , become more complicated .
target: It is likely that structural inconsistency at the word segmentation level complicates the higher levels of processing , including POS tagging and bracketing .

source: The detection method for variation inconsistency is based on N-gram sequences and the phrase structures in VTB treebank , following the definition of variation inconsistency above .
target: The detection method for variation inconsistency is based on N-gram sequences and the phrase structures in the VTB , following the definition for variation inconsistency , above .

source: In details , we counted N-gram sequences of different lengths in VTB that have two or more ways of word segmentation , satisfying one of the following two conditions :
target: In detail , we counted N-gram sequences of different lengths in VTB that have two or more ways of word segmentation , satisfying one of the following two conditions :

source: N tokens are all in the same phrase , and all have the same depth in phrase .
target: N tokens are all in the same phrase , and all have the same depth in phrase .

source: For example , the 3-gram " nhà tình nghĩa ( house of gratitude ) " in this structure " ( NP ( Nc-H căn ) ( N nhà ) ( A tình nghĩa ) ) , " OR N tokens are all in the same phrase , and some tokens can appear in an embedded phrase , which contains only one word .
target: For example , the 3-gram " nhà tình nghĩa ( house of gratitude ) " in this structure " ( NP ( Nc-H căn ) ( N nhà ) ( A tình nghĩa ) ) , " OR N tokens are all in the same phrase , and some tokens can appear in an embedded phrase , which contains only one word .

source: For example , " nhà tình nghĩa " in this structure " ( NP ( Nc-H căn ) ( N nhà ) ( ADJP ( A tình nghĩa ) ) ) , " where the ADJP contains only one word .
target: For example , " nhà tình nghĩa " in this structure " ( NP ( Nc-H căn ) ( N nhà ) ( ADJP ( A tình nghĩa ) ) ) , " where the ADJP contains only one word .

source: Table 3 shows the overall statistics of the variation inconsistency detected by the above method .
target: Table 3 shows the overall statistics of the variation inconsistency detected by the method described above .

target: Most of the diﬃcult cases of word segmentation occur in two-token variations , occupying the majority of variations ( 92.9 % ) .

target: Variations that have lengths of three and four tokens occupy 6.1 % and 1.0 % , respectively .

target: The precision for our method is high , so we can use the extracted variations to provide insights on the word segmentation problem .

target: We further analyzed the 2-gram variations to understand what types of 2-grams were most confusing for annotators .

target: The analysis revealed that compound nouns , compound verbs , and compound adjectives are the most difficult cases of word segmentation .

target: Investigating the inconsistent 2-grams extracted , we found that most of them are compound words , according to the VTB guidelines ( Section 2 ) .

source: In the following section , we presents our detection method for structural inconsistency for classifier nouns and affixes .
target: In the following section , we present our detection method for structural inconsistency for classifier nouns and affixes .

source: The detection method for structural inconsistency of classifier nouns and affixes is simple .
target: The detection method for structural inconsistency of classifier nouns and affixes is simple .

source: First , we collected all affixes and classifier nouns in the VTB corpus . Then extracted 2-grams containing these affixes or classifier nouns , which also are the structural inconsistencies .
target: We collected all affixes and classifier nouns in the VTB corpus , and then extracted 2-grams containing these affixes or classifier nouns , which are also structural inconsistencies .

target: For example , since " con " is tagged as a classifier noun in VTB , we extracted all 2-grams of " con " including both " con gái/girl " and " con trai/boy " .

target: However , in practice , it is confusing when the classifier noun can be standalone as a single word .

target: ORG : The original VTB corpus .

source: BASE : The original VTB corpus + Manual modification of special characters done in Section 3.3 .
target: BASE : The original VTB corpus + Manual modification of special characters done in Section 3.3 .

source: VAR_SPLIT : BASE + split all variations detected in Section 3.1 .
target: VAR_SPLIT : BASE + split all variations detected in Section 3.1 .

source: VAR_COMB : BASE + combine all variations detected in Section 3.1 .
target: VAR_COMB : BASE + combine all variations detected in Section 3.1 .

source: VAR_FREQ : BASE + select the segmentation with higher frequency among all variations detected in Section 3.1 .
target: VAR_FREQ : BASE + select the segmentation with higher frequency among all variations detected in Section 3.1 .

source: STRUCT_NC : BASE + combine all classifier nouns detected in Section 3.2 with the words they modify .
target: STRUCT_NC : BASE + combine all classifier nouns detected in Section 3.2 with the words they modify .

source: STRUCT_AFFIX : BASE + combine all suﬃxes detected in Section 3.2 with the words they modify .
target: STRUCT_AFFIX : BASE + combine all suﬃxes detected in Section 3.2 with the words they modify .

source: In this section , we briefly describe the task settings and the methods used for word segmentation ( WS ) , text classification ( TC ) , and English-Vietnamese statistical machine translation ( SMT ) .
target: In this section , we briefly describe the task settings and the methods used for word segmentation ( WS ) , text classification ( TC ) , and English-Vietnamese statistical machine translation ( SMT ) .

source: We used YamCha ( Kudo and Matsumoto , 2003 ) , a multi-purpose chunking tool , to train our word segmentation models .
target: We used YamCha ( Kudo and Matsumoto , 2003 ) , a multi-purpose chunking tool , to train our word segmentation models .

source: The core of YamCha is the Support Vector Machine ( SVM ) machine learning method , which has been proved to be effective in NLP tasks .
target: The core of YamCha is the Support Vector Machine ( SVM ) machine learning method , which has been proven to be effective for NLP tasks .

source: For the Vietnamese word segmentation problem , each token is labeled with standard B , I , or O labels , corresponding to beginning , inside , and outside positions , respectively .
target: For the Vietnamese word segmentation problem , each token is labeled with standard B , I , or O labels , corresponding to the beginning , inside , and outside positions , respectively .

source: Label of each token is determined based on the lexical features of two preceding words , and two following words of that token .
target: The label of each token is determined based on the lexical features of two preceding words , and the two following words of that token .

source: Since Vietnamese language is not inflectional , we cannot utilize inflection features for word segmentation .
target: Since the Vietnamese language is not inflectional , we cannot utilize inflection features for word segmentation .

source: Each of the seven data sets is splitted into two subsets for training and testing our WS models .
target: Each of the seven data sets is split into two subsets for training and testing our WS models .

source: The training set contains 8443 sentences , and the test set contains 2000 sentences .
target: The training set contains 8443 sentences , and the test set contains 2000 sentences .

source: Text classification is defined as a task of determining for an input document the most suitable topic from the predefined topics .
target: Text classification is defined as a task of determining the most suitable topic from the predefined topics , for an input document .

source: We implemented a text classification system similar to the system presented in ( Nguyen et al . , 2012 ) .
target: We implemented a text classification system similar to the system presented in ( Nguyen et al . , 2012 ) .

source: The difference is that we performed for document level , not for sentence level .
target: The difference is that we performed the task at the document level , instead of at the sentence level .

source: Processing of the system is summarized as follows .
target: The processing of the system is summarized as follows .

source: An input document is preprocessed with word segmentation and stop-word removals .
target: An input document is preprocessed with word segmentation and stop-word removals .

source: Then , the document is represented in the form of a vector of weighted words appearing in the document .
target: Then , the document is represented in the form of a vector of weighted words appearing in the document .

source: The weight is calculated using standard tf-idf product .
target: The weight is calculated using standard tf-idf product .

source: An SVM-based classifier predicts the most probable topic for the vector , which also is the topic of the input document .
target: An SVM-based classifier predicts the most probable topic for the vector , which also is the topic for the input document .

source: In our experiment , for comparison of diﬀerent word segmentation criteria in topic classification , we only vary the word segmentation model used for this task , while fixing other configurations .
target: In our experiment , for comparison of diﬀerent word segmentation criteria in topic classification , we only vary the word segmentation model used for this task , while fixing other configurations .

source: News articles of five topics : music , stock , entertainment , education , and fashion are used .
target: News articles of five topics : music , stock , entertainment , education , and fashion are used .

source: The sizes of the training and test data sets are summarized in Table 8 .
target: The sizes of the training and test data sets are summarized in Table 8 .

source: A phrase-based SMT system for English-Vietnamese translation was implemented .
target: A phrase-based SMT system for English-Vietnamese translation was implemented .

source: In this system , we used SRILM ( Stolcke , 2002 ) to build the language model , GIZA++ ( Och and Ney , 2003 ) to train the word-aligned model , and Moses ( Holmqvist et al . , 2007 ) to train the phrase-based statistical translation model .
target: In this system , we used SRILM ( Stolcke , 2002 ) to build the language model , GIZA++ ( Och and Ney , 2003 ) to train the word-aligned model , and Moses ( Holmqvist et al . , 2007 ) to train the phrase-based statistical translation model .

source: Translation results are evaluated using BLUE score ( Papineni et al . , 2002 ) .
target: Translation results are evaluated using the BLUE score ( Papineni et al . , 2002 ) .

source: Both training and test data are word-segmented using the word segmentation models achieved .
target: Both training and test data are word-segmented using the word segmentation models achieved .

source: For the experiment , we used the VCL_EVC bilingual corpus , 18000 pairs of sentences for training , and 1000 pairs for testing .
target: For the experiment , we used the VCL_EVC bilingual corpus , 18000 pairs of sentences for training , and 1000 pairs for testing .

source: According to the result in Table 9 , the VAR_SPLIT criterion gives the highest WS performance .
target: According to the result in Table 9 , the VAR_SPLIT criterion gives the highest WS performance .

target: With the exception of STRUCT_NC , all of the modifications to the original VTB corpus increase the performance of WS .

target: However , the word segmentation criterion with higher performance is not necessarily a better criterion , but a criterion should also be judged through applications of word segmentation .

source: In both SMT and TC experiments , the BASE model , which is based on the manually-modified inconsistency of special characters , achieved better results than the ORG model .
target: In both SMT and TC experiments , the BASE model , which is based on the manually-modified inconsistency of special characters , achieved better results than the ORG model .

target: In particular , in the TC experiment , the BASE model achieved 0.66 point higher than ORG , which is a significant improvement .

target: The results support the conclusion that the quality of the word-segmentation corpus is very important for building NLP applications .

target: The SMT results show that three out of six augmented models , VAR_SPLIT , VAR_FREQ and BASE , performed better than the ORG configuration .

target: Among them , the best-performing model , VAR_SPLIT achieved 36.91 BLEU score , which is 0.55 higher than ORG .

source: In TC results , all six augmented models have higher results than ORG .
target: In TC results , all six augmented models achieved higher results than ORG .

target: In general , the augmented models performed better than the ORG .

target: Additionally , because our automatic methods for inconsistency detection could not cover all of the types of inconsistencies in word segmentation annotation , further improvement of corpus quality is demanded .

source: Comparing the results of STRUCT_AFFIX and STRUCT_NC with BASE in WS , TC , and SMT , we can observe that combining aﬃxes with their head nouns resulted in slightly better results for WS , TC , and does not change the performance of SMT .
target: Comparing the results of STRUCT_AFFIX and STRUCT_NC with BASE in WS , TC , and SMT , we can observe that combining aﬃxes with their head nouns resulted in slightly better results for WS and TC , and did not change the performance of SMT .

target: Another part of the scope of our experiment is to compare two solutions for controversial cases of word segmentation , splitting and combining .

target: Since the ratio of combined variations in the ORG corpus is 60.9 % , it can be observed that splitting seems to be better than combining for WS , TC and SMT .

source: In this paper , we have showed a quantitative analysis of the difficulties in word segmentation , through the detection of problematic cases in the Vietnamese treebank .
target: In this paper , we have provided a quantitative analysis of the difficulties in word segmentation , through the detection of problematic cases in the Vietnamese Treebank .

source: Based on the analysis , we automatically created data representing the different word segmentation criteria , and evaluated the criteria indirectly through their applications .
target: Based on the analysis , we automatically created data that represent the different word segmentation criteria , and evaluated the criteria indirectly through their applications .

source: Our experimental results showed that manual modification done for annotation of spe cial characters , and most of other word segmentation criteria , significantly improved the performances of automatic word segmentation , text classification and statistical machine translation , comparing with the use of the original VTB corpus .
target: Our experimental results showed that manual modification , done for annotation of special characters , and most other word segmentation criteria , significantly improved the performances of automatic word segmentation , text classification and statistical machine translation , in comparison with the use of the original VTB corpus .

source: Since the VTB corpus is the first eﬀort in building a treebank for Vietnamese , and is the only corpus publicly available for NLP research , this study contributes to further improvement of the corpus quality , which is essential for building efficient NLP systems .
target: Since the VTB corpus is the first eﬀort in building a treebank for Vietnamese , and is the only corpus that is publicly available for NLP research , this study contributes to further improvement of the corpus quality , which is essential for building efficient NLP systems .

source: Generating short summary videos for rushes is a challenging task due to difficulty in redundancy elimination and determination of important objects and events being placed in the summary .
target: Generating short summary videos for rushes is a challenging task due to the difficulty in eliminating redundancy and determining the important objects and events to be placed in the summary .

source: Redundancy elimination is difficult since repetitive segments , which are takes of the same scene , usually have different lengths and motion patterns .
target: Redundancy elimination is difficult since repetitive segments , which are takes of the same scene , usually have different lengths and motion patterns .

source: This makes approaches using one keyframe for shot representation failed in doing clustering .
target: This makes approaches using one keyframe for a shot representation fail when trying to form a cluster .

source: In addition , even repetitive segments can be determined precisely , the summary generated by concatenating together selected segments still has longer duration than the upper limit .
target: In addition , even repetitive segments can be precisely determined , but the summary generated by concatenating together the selected segments still takes longer than the upper limit .

source: It is questionable to select a sub-segment so that it conveys information of the scene as much as possible .
target: It is questionable to select a sub-segment so that it conveys information of the scene as much as possible .

source: In this paper , we introduce two approaches to these problems .
target: , We introduce two approaches to solve these problems .

source: In the first approach , one keyframe is used for shot representation in doing clustering ; and sub-segments are selected using motion information for generating the summary .
target: In the first approach , one keyframe is used for representing a shot when forming a cluster ; and sub-segments are selected using the motion information for generating the summary .

source: Meanwhile , in the second approach , all frames of a shot are used for clustering ; and a simple skimming method is used to select sub-segments .
target: Meanwhile , in the second approach , all the frames of a given shot are used for clustering ; and a simple skimming method is used to select the sub-segments .

source: Experimental results on the TRECVID 2008 dataset and comparison between the two approaches are reported .
target: The experimental results on the TRECVID 2008 dataset and a comparison between the two approaches are also reported .

source: With the availability of multimedia databases growing at an exponential rate , users are increasingly requiring assistance in accessing digital video contents .
target: With the availability of multimedia databases growing at an exponential rate , users are increasingly requiring assistance in accessing digital video contents .

source: Video summarization is a significant research that helps to meet these needs by developing a condensed version of a full length digital video with the most important contents \CITE .
target: Video summarization significantly helps to meet this need by developing a condensed version of a full length digital video using only the most important contents \CITE .

source: Summary videos can help users to browse and navigate large video archives efficiently and effectively .
target: Summary videos can help users more efficiently and effectively browse and navigate through large video archives .

source: Generating summary videos for BBC rushes \CITE is a challenging task due to difficulty in redundancy elimination and determination of important objects and events being placed in the summary .
target: Generating summary videos for BBC rushes \CITE is a challenging task due to the difficulty with redundancy elimination and determining the most important objects and events to be placed in the summary .

source: Since the length of the summary is limited to 2\ % duration of the original video , there is a trade-off between recall and usability ( e.g user friendly through smooth presentation , being easy to understand ) .
target: Since the length of the summary is limited to 2\ % duration of the original video , there is a trade-off between the recall and usability ( e.g . user friendly through smooth presentation , / being easy to understand ) .

source: High recall , i .e many objects and events ( called scenes ) are included in the summary , usually reduce the number of frames for each scene .
target: High recall , i .e . many objects and events ( called scenes ) included in the summary , usually reduces the number of frames for each scene .

source: For example , the maximum duration for the summary of a 30 minute length video is 36 seconds ( \MATH ) .
target: For example , the maximum duration for a summary of a 30 minute video is 36 seconds ( \MATH ) .

source: If the summary consists of 20 scenes , the average duration for each scene is 1.8 seconds .
target: If the summary consists of 20 scenes , the average duration for each scene is 1.8 seconds .

source: For the event such as " ` Woman attacks man on bench on left and runs off with large bag .
target: For an event such as " ` Woman attacks man on bench on left and runs off with large bag .

source: " ' , with this length constraint , it is difficult to present it in a pleasant tempo and rhythm .
target: " ' , with this length constraint , it would be difficult to present it in a pleasant tempo and rhythm .

source: On the contrary , smooth presentation of events consumes a lot number of frames , that decrease the recall .
target: On the other hand , a smooth presentation of these events would consume a large number of frames , which would decrease the recall .

source: In general , generating summary videos consists of the following steps :
target: In general , generating summary videos consists of the following steps :

source: Video segmentation : This step decomposes the original video into segments , such shots or sub-shots .
target: Video segmentation : This step breaks down the original video into segments , such as shots or sub-shots .

source: Each segment should be aligned such that it is a part of a scene .
target: Each segment should be aligned so that it is a part of a scene .

source: Redundancy elimination : This step groups segments that belong to the same take into clusters .
target: Redundancy elimination : This step groups the segments that belong to the same take into clusters .

source: Only one representative segment is used for the final summary video .
target: Only one representative segment is used for the final summary video .

source: The others are discarded .
target: The others are discarded .

source: Junk elimination : This step removes color bars , clapboards , all black or all white frames that are unnecessary for the final summary video .
target: Junk elimination : This step removes the color bars , clapboards , and the all black or all white frames that are unnecessary in the final summary video .

source: Summary generation : This step selects frames from representative segments of clusters and concatenate to form the final summary video .
target: Summary generation : This step selects the frames from the representative segments of clusters and concatenates them to form the final summary video .

source: While the steps of video segmentation and junk elimination are easy to handle , the steps of redundancy elimination and summary generation are difficult .
target: While the steps for video segmentation and junk elimination are easy to handle , the steps for redundancy elimination and summary generation are difficult .

source: For example , as for redundancy elimination , the question is how to represent a segment into a feature vector and how to compute the similarity between two segments having different length and motion pattern .
target: For example , as for redundancy elimination , the question is how to represent a segment in a feature vector and how to compute the similarity between two segments having different lengths and motion patterns .

source: In the other case , assume that we have selected appropriate segments , the total length of these segments are usually larger than that of the final summary .
target: In the other case , assuming that we have selected the appropriate segments , the total length of these segments is usually larger than that of the final summary .

source: The question is how to determine the important part of the selected segment such that it conveys information of the scene as much as possible .
target: The question is how to determine the most important parts of the selected segments so that they convey as much of the information of the scene as possible .

source: In this paper , we present two approaches for handling these difficult steps .
target: In this paper , we present two approaches for handling these difficult steps .

source: The first approach represents each segment by one key-frame and groups similar segments by doing clustering on these key-frames .
target: The first approach represents each segment by using one key-frame and groups similar segments by clustering them on these key-frames .

source: Then the portion of each segment that has high motion is used to include into the final summary .
target: Then the portion of each segment that has the highest motion is included in the final summary .

source: Meanwhile , the second approach uses another strategy for redundancy elimination .
target: Meanwhile , the second approach uses another strategy for redundancy elimination .

source: Specifically , for each segment , a set of frames are extracted by sampling at a certain time interval ( e.g 5 frames ) .
target: Specifically , for each segment , a set of frames are extracted by sampling at a certain time interval ( e.g . 5 frames ) .

source: The clustering process is performed on the frames of all segments .
target: The clustering process is performed on the frames of all the segments .

source: Then , the segments that share a large enough number of frames with respect to their size are merged into one cluster .
target: Then , segments that share a large enough number of frames with respect to their size are merged into one cluster .

source: In order to generate the final summary , with each representative segment , the middle part is selected with the skim rate of 2 frames .
target: In order to generate the final summary , with each representative segment , the middle part is selected with a skim rate of 2 frames .

target: Finally , section \REF and section \REF conclude the paper .

source: This system is adopted with some modifications from the system developed for the same task last year \CITE .
