target: Figure 4 illustrates how the decision list works when comparing two candidates : and .

source: More details about the implementation of the main components of our system shown in Figure 2 are presented below .
target: More details concerning the implementation of the main components of our system shown in Figure 2 are presented below .

source: In this step , we want to filter out those pronouns and definite noun phrases that are not target of this task , comprised of two types : non-anaphoric expressions , and anaphoric expressions which do not point to proteins .
target: In this step , we want to filter out those pronouns and definite noun phrases that are not a target of this task . The expressions are comprised of two types : non-anaphoric expressions , and anaphoric expressions , which do not point to proteins .

source: The term anaphoric is used with the common sense in NLP community .
target: The term anaphoric is used with the common sense in the NLP community .

source: Anaphoric expression means an expression that has a noun phrase as antecedent .
target: Anaphoric expression refers to an expression that has a noun phrase as an antecedent .

source: This means expressions with a sentence or phrase antecedents , or nominal but successive antecedents , are not our target and should be filtered out .
target: Thus , expressions with a sentence or phrase antecedents , or nominal but successive antecedents , are not our target and should be filtered out .

source: Non-anaphoric expressions includes first and second person pronouns such as I , we , you , . . . , and pleonastic it .
target: Non-anaphoric expressions include first and second-person pronouns such as I , we , you , and pleonastic it .

source: First and second person pronouns are easily to be recognized by the part-of-speech tags , thus we use part-of-speech information for the filtering .
target: First and second-person pronouns are easily recognized by the part-of-speech tags ; thus , we use part-of-speech information for the filtering .

source: For pleonastic it , we make use of the following four patterns , which are similar to [ 13 ]
target: For pleonastic it , we make use of the following four patterns , which are similar to [ 13 ] :

source: It be [ Adj|Adv| verb ]* that
target: It be [ Adj|Adv| verb ]* that

source: It be Adj [ for NP ] to VP
target: It be Adj [ for NP ] to VP

source: It [ seems|appears|means|follows ] [ that ]*
target: It [ seems|appears|means|follows ] [ that ]*

source: NP [ makes|finds|take ] it [ Adj ]* [ for NP ]* [ to VP|Ving ]
target: NP [ makes|finds|take ] it [ Adj ]* [ for NP ]* [ to VP|Ving ]

source: To recognize and filter anaphoric expressions which do not point to proteins , the system is based on the protein semantic classification results determined by the method presented below .
target: To recognize and filter anaphoric expressions that do not point to proteins , the system is based on the protein semantic classification results determined by the method presented below .

source: For each anaphoric markable , the system collects a list of antecedent candidates , and select the most probable candidate to be the antecedent of the anaphor .
target: For each anaphoric markable , the system collects a list of antecedent candidates , and select the most probable candidate to be the antecedent of the anaphor .

source: Basically all expressions detected in the initial expression set are antecedent candidate , except for anaphoric pronouns .
target: Basically , all of the expressions detected in the initial expression set are an antecedent candidate , with the exception of anaphoric pronouns .

source: However , if the list contains too many candidates , then it may be more difficult for the later antecedent-selection algorithm .
target: However , if the list contains too many candidates , then it may be more difficult for the later antecedent-selection algorithm .

source: Therefore , candidates that are not probable to be antecedent of the anaphor should be filtered out .
target: Therefore , candidates that are not probable to be an antecedent of the anaphor should be filtered out .

source: There are several filters that can be used :
target: There are several filters that can be used :

source: Window size sets a border to include or exclude antecedent candidates .
target: Window size Borders are set to include or exclude antecedent candidates .

source: This is a common method for antecedent candidate filtering having been used in the previous work [ 3 , 5 , 26 ] .
target: This is a common method for antecedent candidate filtering , as seen in the previous work [ 3 , 5 , 26 ] .

source: Since our task focuses on anaphoric coreference , antecedent expressions normally appear not too far ( in sentence distance ) from the anaphors , using window sizes is a proper technique .
target: Since our task focuses on anaphoric coreference , antecedent expressions normally appear not too far ( in sentence distance ) from the anaphors . Thus , using window sizes is a proper technique .

source: Syntactic dependency relations The fact that arguments of some dependency relations such as poss-arg12 and prep-arg12 do not corefer with each other enables us to use them to correctly eliminate the number of antecedent candidates .
target: Syntactic dependency relations Since arguments of some dependency relations ( such as poss-arg12 and prep-arg12 ) do not corefer with each other , they can be used to correctly eliminate the number of antecedent candidates .

source: For instance , two such truncated forms definitely cannot be antecedent of the protein in this context two such truncated forms of the protein
target: For instance , two such truncated forms definitely cannot be an antecedent of the protein in this context : two such truncated forms of the protein .

source: After filtering non-relevant antecedent candidates for an anaphor in the above step , depending on the anaphor type , the remained candidates are ranked by fixed rules , or by using a pairwise comparison procedure :
target: After filtering non-relevant antecedent candidates for an anaphor in the step above , depending on the anaphor type , the remaining candidates are ranked by fixed rules , or by using a pairwise comparison procedure :

source: The relative pronoun can be said to be the easiest type of coreference resolution , because its antecedent expression is very close to the anaphor , and in many cases , it is right before the anaphor .
target: The relative pronoun can be said to be the easiest type of coreference resolution , because its antecedent expression is very close to the anaphor , and in many cases , it is right before the anaphor .

source: For this type of anaphors , any syntactic parser can be used to find the relations between relative pronouns and their arguments .
target: For these types of anaphors , any syntactic parser can be used to find the relation between relative pronouns and their arguments .

source: This is exactly what our system does .
target: Our system accomplishes this task .

source: It simply produces coreference links between the relative pronouns and their arguments .
target: It simply produces coreference links between the relative pronouns and their arguments .

source: However , a disadvantage of this method is when the parser makes mistake on finding the correct arguments , coreference also fails , as in the example " . . .of transcription factor NF-kappa B also encodes a p70 I kappa B protein , I kappa B gamma , which is identical to the C-terminal 607 amino acids of . . . "
target: However , a disadvantage to using this method is that when the parser makes a mistake on finding the correct arguments , the coreference also fails . This is exemplified in the following : " . . .of transcription factor NF-kappa B also encodes a p70 I kappa B protein , I kappa B gamma , which is identical to the C-terminal 607 amino acids of . . . "

source: This procedure compares two candidate expressions at a time with respect to preferences raised by the anaphor .
target: This procedure compares two candidate expressions at a time with respect to preferences raised by the anaphor .

source: The best antecedent expression is selected to form a response coreference link .
target: The best antecedent expression is selected to form a response coreference link .

source: In particular , a list of rules is used to compare two candidates of an anaphor in a deterministic manner .
target: In particular , a list of rules is used to compare two candidates of an anaphor in a deterministic manner .

source: For each rule , both of the candidates are checked against the condition hold by that rule .
target: For each rule , both of the candidates are checked against the condition hold by that rule .

source: If one candidate satisfies and the other does not , the procedure ends with the result that the former will be preferable to the latter .
target: If one candidate satisfies and the other does not , the procedure ends with the result that the former will be preferable over the latter .

source: If both satisfy or both do not satisfy , the procedure proceeds to the next rule in the same manner .
target: If both satisfy or both do not satisfy , the procedure proceeds to the next rule in the same manner .

source: The rules are applied in a succession order one after another until the inequality occurs , or end of the rule list is reached .
target: The rules are applied in a successive order , one after another , until the inequality occurs , or until the end-of-the-rule list is reached .

source: The default rule of the procedure prefers the closer antecedent candidate .
target: The default rule of the procedure , is in the preference of the closer antecedent candidate .

source: By definition , two coreferential expressions refer to the same thing , which implies a semantic-constraint on coreference relationship .
target: By definition , two coreferential expressions are identical , which implies a semantic-constraint on coreference relationship .

source: In other words , semantic types of coreferents must be compatible .
target: In other words , semantic types of coreferents must be compatible .

source: In practice , this compatibility is checked based on a given taxonomy of semantic classes in the following manner : two semantic classes are considered compatible or agreed with each other , when they have synonym relation , e.g . , or hypernym-hyponym relation .
target: In practice , this compatibility is checked based on a given taxonomy of semantic classes in the following manner : two semantic classes are considered compatible or agreed with each other , when they have a synonym relation , or hypernym-hyponym relation .

source: In this work , we only focus on the Protein type , ignoring other possible semantic types , so we do not take the structure of taxonomy into account .
target: In this work , we only focus on the Protein type , ignoring other possible semantic types , so the structure of the taxonomy is not taken into account .

source: Thus , the likelihood that two expressions are semantically compatible is definitely beneficial for antecedent prediction , besides syntactic information .
target: Therefore , the likelihood that two expressions are semantically compatible , is definitely beneficial for antecedent prediction , besides syntactic information .

source: Focusing on specific entity types , i .e . Protein type , helps us to find a proper method for determining the likelihood , and how to encode the likelihood in coreference resolution .
target: Focusing on specific entity types , i .e . , Protein type , enables us to find a proper method for determining the likelihood , and method for encoding the likelihood in coreference resolution .

source: Since gold protein annotations are given , we can use them in combination with syntactic information to judge whether an expression is protein-referential expession or not .
target: Since gold protein annotations are given , we can use them in combination with syntactic information to judge whether an expression is a protein-referential expression or not .

source: In details , if an expression is a noun phrase with a single head word , and it contains a protein mention that completely overlaps with the head word , then the expression is classied as Protein .
target: If an expression is a noun phrase with a single head word , and it contains a protein mention that completely overlaps with the head word , then the expression is classified as Protein .

source: Another case is when the head noun is either protein or gene , and has a protein mention as its premodifier , such as the Tax protein .
target: In another case , when the head noun is either protein or gene , and has a protein mention as its premodifier , such as the Tax protein .

source: For a coordinated noun phrase , if one of its constituents is classified as Protein , then that noun phrase is also classified as Protein .
target: For a coordinated noun phrase , if one of its constituents is classified as a Protein , then that noun phrase is also classified as a Protein .

source: Pronouns , in particular , possessive pronouns occupy the majority of anaphoric pronouns in biological texts ( Table 5 ) .
target: Pronouns , in particular , possessive pronouns , occupy the majority of anaphoric pronouns in biological texts ( Table 5 ) .

source: However , they do not contain in themselves much useful information for the resolution , thus we need to exploit more information from its context [ 17 ] .
target: However , they do not contain very much useful information for the resolution ; thus , we need to exploit more information from its context [ 17 ] .

source: The analysis of BioNLP-ST 2011 also showed that we need different strategy to resolve such pronouns [ 18 ] .
target: The analysis of BioNLP-ST 2011 also showed that we need a different strategy to resolve such pronouns [ 18 ] .

source: Fortunately , the key to this problem lies in the context of pronouns .
target: Fortunately , the key to this problem lies in the context of pronouns .

source: We implemented a simple function to classify the semantic type of a possessive pronoun based on its context word .
target: We implemented a simple function to classify the semantic type of a possessive pronoun , based on its context word .

source: In particular , we check the noun phrase whose determiner is its or their ; if the noun phrase contains a protein key word then the inclusive pronoun is classified into the Protein semantic type .
target: In particular , we check the noun phrase in which the determiner is its or their ; if the noun phrase contains a protein key word , then the inclusive pronoun is classified into the Protein semantic type .

source: protein key words can be a verb , a noun or an adjective that coocurred with protein mentions and can be used as a clue to distinguish the protein type from other semantic types .
target: Protein key words can be a verb , a noun or an adjective that co-occurred with protein mentions , and can be used as a clue to distinguish the protein type from other semantic types .

source: For example , the word binding in the following noun phrases its heterodimeric binding partner , or its binding site is a good clue to infer that it must be a protein reference .
target: For example , the word binding in the following noun phrases : its heterodimeric binding partner , or its binding site , is a clue to infer that it must be a protein reference .

source: For our preliminary experiment , we collect these key words manually by checking the noun phrases containing its and their in training data .
target: For our preliminary experiment , we collect these keywords manually by checking the noun phrases containing its and their in the training data .

source: Our final protein key word set includes 12 words : binding , expression , interaction , regulation , phosphatase activity , localization , gene , sequence , region , phosphorylation , transactivation , and transcription .
target: Our final protein keyword set includes 12 words : binding , expression , interaction , regulation , phosphatase activity , localization , gene , sequence , region , phosphorylation , transactivation , and transcription .

source: In future , the protein key words can be collected automatically using the term corpus , or other resources of proteins .
target: In future , the protein key words can be collected automatically using the term corpus , or other resources of proteins .

source: Coreferential definite noun phrases in text are used in broader meaning of coreference .
target: Coreferential definite noun phrases in text are used to include a broader definition of coreference .

source: In other words , their antecedents do not necessarily exist in the textual context ; in particular in biomedical scientific papers , many definite noun phrases do not have antecedents since the referred concepts can be anything understood by experts in the domain .
target: In other words , their antecedents do not necessarily exist in the textual context ; in particular , in biomedical scientific papers , many definite noun phrases do not have antecedents , since the referenced concepts can include any concept that is understood by subject matter experts in the domain .

source: Distinguishing such non-anaphoric definite noun phrases from anaphoric ones is an uneasy task .
target: Distinguishing such non-anaphoric definite noun phrases from anaphoric ones is a difficult task .

source: Knowing their semantic type helps to filter out irrelevant candidate antecedents , increasing chance to pick up the right antecedent or the precision of antecedent prediction .
target: Knowing their semantic type helps to filter out irrelevant candidate antecedents , thereby increasing the chance of picking up the right antecedent , and increasing the precision of antecedent prediction .

source: In our implementation , decision to keep an anaphoric expression for further processing steps for an anaphoric definite noun phrase is based on a protein head word list .
target: In our implementation , the decision to keep an anaphoric expression for further processing steps for an anaphoric definite noun phrase is based on a protein head word list .

source: We tested two different head word lists : one is built automatically from the gold anaphoric nominals in gold data , the other word list contains top seven common head words : protein , gene , factor , molecule , element , family , inhibitor , and receptor .
target: We tested two different head word lists : one is built automatically from the gold anaphoric nominals in gold data ; the other word list contains the top seven common head words : protein , gene , factor , molecule , element , family , inhibitor , and receptor .

source: Semantic type information can be used in coreference resolution in several ways .
target: Semantic type information can be used in coreference resolution in several ways .

source: First , in anaphor selection , semantic information can be used to filter out non-protein anaphoric expressions .
target: First , in anaphor selection , semantic information can be used to filter out non-protein anaphoric expressions .

source: Second , in antecedent candidate filtering , semantic agreement between the antecedent candidates and the anaphoric expression is checked .
target: Second , in antecedent candidate filtering , semantic agreement between the antecedent candidates and the anaphoric expression is checked .

source: Those candidates which are not agree with the anaphor in semantics are filtered out .
target: Those candidates that are not in agreement with the anaphor in semantics are filtered out .

source: For example , if anaphor is classified as protein referent , then non-protein antecedent candidates are removed from the candidate set of the anaphor .
target: For example , if an anaphor is classified as a protein referent , then the non-protein antecedent candidates are removed from the candidate set of the anaphor .

source: Finally , in antecedent prediction : semantic agreement again can be used as a constraint when comparing two antecedent candidates to select the more probable candidate .
target: Finally , in antecedent prediction : semantic agreement can again be used as a constraint when comparing two antecedent candidates to select the more probable candidate .

source: Our minimal system configuration includes all the processing and filters from step 0 to step 3 as explained in the above section ( RB-MIN ) .
target: Our minimal system configuration includes all of the processing and filters from step 0 to step 3 , as explained in the section above ( RB-MIN ) .

source: For antecedent candidate selection , the window size used in step 4 is set to 2 , which means antecedent candidates are collected in the two nearest sentences from the anaphor , and the sentence embedding the anaphor .
target: For antecedent candidate selection , the window size used in step 4 is set to 2 , which means that antecedent candidates are collected in the two nearest sentences from the anaphor , and the sentence embedding the anaphor .

target: The statistics measured on the training set of the corpus shows that 97 .0 % percent of protein coreference links have antecedents appearing in within 2 sentences .

target: With this window size , the average number of candidates per anaphor is 6 .1 .

target: The word list used to filter out anaphoric definite noun phrases in step 2 contains the following words : protein , gene , factor , molecule , element , family , inhibitor , and receptor .

source: These words are selected from the top appearring head words extracted from the training data .
target: These words are selected from the top appearing head words extracted from the training data .

target: In order to strengthen the automatic processing of the Vietnamese language , the Vietnamese Treebank ( VTB ) has been built as a part of the national project , `` Vietnamese language and speech processing ( VLSP ) '' ( Nguyen et al . , 2009b ) .

target: However , in our preliminary experiment with VTB , when we trained the Berkeley parser ( Petrov et al . , 2006 ) and evaluated it by using the corpus , the parser achieved only 65 .8 % in F-score .

target: This score is far lower than the state-of-the-art performance reported for the Berkeley Parser on the English Penn Treebank , which reported 90 .3 % in F-score ( Petrov et al . , 2006 ) .

source: There are two possible reasons for this .
target: There are two possible reasons to explain this outcome .

target: One reason for this outcome is the quality of VTB , including the quality of the annotation scheme , the annotation guidelines , and the annotation process .

source: Second , parsing Vietnamese is a diffcult problem by its own , and we need to seek new solutions to the problem .
target: The second reason is the difficulty of parsing Vietnamese ; we need to seek new solutions to address this problem .

source: VTB is annotated with three layers : word segmentation , POS tagging , and bracketing .
target: VTB is annotated with three layers : word segmentation , POS tagging , and bracketing .

source: This paper focuses on the word segmentation issues since the most basic unit of a treebank is word ( Di Sciullo and Edwin , 1987 ) , and defining `` What are words ? '' is the first problem that a treebank has to solve ( Xia , 2000b ,a ; Sornlertlamvanich et al . , 1997 , 1999 ) .
target: This paper focuses on the word segmentation , since the most basic unit of a treebank are words ( Di Sciullo and Edwin , 1987 ) , and defining `` words '' is the first step ( Xia , 2000b ,a ; Sornlertlamvanich et al . , 1997 , 1999 ) .

source: For languages like English , answering this question is almost trivial because the blank spaces denote word delimiters .
target: For languages like English , defining `` words '' is almost trivial , because the blank spaces denote word delimiters .

source: However , for an isolating language like Vietnamese , where blank spaces play a role of syllable delimiters , `` What are words ? '' is not a trivial question .
target: However , for an isolating language like Vietnamese , for which blank spaces play a role of syllable delimiters , `` What are words ? '' is not a trivial question .

source: For example , the sentence `` H❅c sinh h❅c sinh h❅c ( students learn biology )1 '' is composed of three words `` h❅c sinh ( student ) '' , `` h❅c ( learn ) , '' and `` sinh h❅c ( biology ) ; '' Word segmentation is expected to break down the sentence at the boundaries of these words , not to split `` h❅c sinh ( student ) '' and `` sinh h❅c ( biology ) '' .
target: For example , the sentence `` H❅c sinh h❅c sinh h❅c ( students learn biology )1 '' is composed of three words , `` h❅c sinh ( student ) '' , `` h❅c ( learn ) , '' and `` sinh h❅c ( biology ) '' . Word segmentation is expected to break down the sentence at the boundaries of these words , instead of splitting `` h❅c sinh ( student ) '' and `` sinh h❅c ( biology ) '' .

source: Note that the terminology `` word segmentation '' also refers to the task of extracting words statistically without concerning a gold-standard for segmentation , as in ( Ha , 2003 ; Le et al . , 2010 ) .
target: Note that the terminology `` word segmentation '' also refers to the task of extracting words statistically without concerning a gold-standard for segmentation , as in ( Ha , 2003 ; Le et al . , 2010 ) .

source: In such context , the extracted words are more appropriate for building a dictionary than for corpus-based language processing , which are out of the focus of this paper .
target: In such a context , the extracted words are more appropriate for building a dictionary , rather than for corpus-based language processing , which are outside of the scope of this paper .

source: Establishing a gold standard for Vietnamese word segmentation faces some diffcuties coming from the characteristics of the language .
target: Because of the discussed characteristics of the language , there are challenges in establishing a gold standard for Vietnamese word segmentation .

source: The diffculties of Vietnamese word segmentation have been recognized by many researchers ( Ha , 2003 ; Nguyen et al . , 2004 , 2006 ; Le et al . , 2010 ) .
target: The difficulties in Vietnamese word segmentation have been recognized by many researchers ( Ha , 2003 ; Nguyen et al . , 2004 , 2006 ; Le et al . , 2010 ) .

source: Although most people agree that the Vietnamese language has two types of words : single and compound , there is little consensus on how to segment a sentence into words .
target: Although most people agree that the Vietnamese language has two types of words : single and compound , there is little consensus as to the methodology for segmenting a sentence into words .

source: The disagreement is not only because of the different functions of blank spaces as mentioned above , but also because Vietnamese is not an inflectional language like English or Japanese , where morphological forms can be useful clues for word segmentation .
target: The disagreement occurs not only because of the different functions of blank spaces ( as mentioned above ) , but also because Vietnamese is not an inflectional language , as is the case for English or Japanese , for which morphological forms can provide useful clues for word segmentation .

source: While the similar problems also happen with Chinese word segmentation ( Xia , 2000b ) , Vietnamese word segmentation may be more diffcult because the modern Vietnamese writing system is based on Latin characters , which represents the pronunciation but not the meaning of words .
target: While similar problems also occur with Chinese word segmentation ( Xia , 2000b ) , Vietnamese word segmentation may be more difficult , because the modern Vietnamese writing system is based on Latin characters , which represent the pronunciation , but not the meaning of words .

source: All these characteristics make it diffcult to perform word segmentation for Vietnamese both manually and automatically , and have resulted in different criteria for word segmenation .
target: All of these characteristics make it diffcult to perform word segmentation for Vietnamese , both manually and automatically , and have thus resulted in different criteria for word segmentation .

source: However , so far there have been few studies on the challenges in word segmentation , and the comparison of different word segmentation criteria .
target: However , so far , there have been few studies on the challenges in word segmentation , and the comparison of different word segmentation criteria .

target: In this paper , a brief introduction of the Vietnamese Treebank VTB and its annotation scheme are provided in Section 2 .

target: Then , we described our methods for the detection and correction of the problematic annotations in the VTB corpus ( Section 4 .2 ) .

target: Finally , we evaluated these criteria in automatic word segmentation , and its application in text classification and English-Vietnamese statistical machine translation , in Section 4 .

target: This study is not only beneficial for the development of computational processing technologies for Vietnamese , a language spoken by over 90 million people , but also for similar languages such as Thai , Laos , and so on .

target: This study also promotes the computational linguistic studies on how to transfer methods developed for a popular language , like English , to a language that has not yet been intensively studied .

source: Word segmentation in VTB aims to found a standard for word segmentation in a context of multi-level language processing .
target: Word segmentation in VTB aims at establishing a standard for word segmentation in a context of multi-level language processing .

source: VTB specifies 12 types of units that should be identified as words ( Table 1 ) ( Nguyen et al . , a ) , which can be divided into three groups : single , compound , and special `` words '' .
target: VTB specifies 12 types of units that should be identified as words ( Table 1 ) ( Nguyen et al . , a ) , which can be divided up into three groups : single , compound , and special `` words '' .

source: Single words contain only one token .
target: Single words contain only one token .

source: The terminology tokens refers to text spans separated with each other by blank spaces .
target: The terminology tokens refers to text spans that are separated from each other by blank spaces .

source: Compound words have two or more tokens , and are divided into four types : compound words composed by semantic coordination ( semantic-coordinated compound ) , compound words composed by semantic subordination ( semantic-subordinated compound ) , compound words with affx , and reduplicated words .
target: Compound words have two or more tokens , and are divided into four types : compound words composed by semantic coordination ( semantic-coordinated compound ) , compound words composed by semantic subordination ( semantic-subordinated compound ) , compound words with an affx , and reduplicated words .

source: Special `` words '' can be idioms , locutions , proper names , date times , numbers , symbols , sentence marks , foreign words , or abbreviations .
target: Special `` words '' include idioms , locutions , proper names , date times , numbers , symbols , sentence marks , foreign words , or abbreviations .

source: The segmentation of these types of words forms a basis for the POS tagging , with 18 different POS tags shown in Table 2 ( Nguyen et al . , c ) .
target: The segmentation of these types of words forms a basis for the POS tagging , with 18 different POS tags , as shown in Table 2 ( Nguyen et al . , c ) .

source: Each unit in Table 1 goes with several example words of which English translations are given in parentheses .
target: Each unit in Table 1 goes with several example words ; English translations are provided in parentheses .

target: Furthermore , we added a translation for each token , where possible , so that readers who are unfamiliar with Vietnamese can have an intuitive idea as to how the compound words are formed .

source: The subscript of a token translation is the index of that token in the compound word .
target: The subscript of a token translation is the index of that token in the compound word .

target: However , for some tokens , we could not find any appropriate English translation , so we gave it an empty translation , marked with an asterisk .

source: Note that a Vietnamese word or a token in context can have other meanings in addition to the given translations .
target: Note that a Vietnamese word or a token in context can have other meanings , in addition to the given translations .

source: A special type of words in Vietnamese is classifer noun , denoted by the part-of-speech Nc in Table 2 .
target: A classifier noun , denoted by the part-of-speech Nc in Table 2 , is a special type of word in Vietnamese .

source: Classifier nouns are specific to several Southeast Asian languages like Vietnamese and Thai .
target: Classifier nouns are specific to several Southeast Asian languages , like Vietnamese and Thai .

source: One of the functions of classifier nouns is to express the definiteness .
target: One of the functions of classifier nouns is to express the definiteness .

source: For example , the common noun `` bàn '' means tables in general , while `` cái bàn '' means a specific table similar to the table in English .
target: For example , the common noun `` bàn '' generally means tables , while `` cái bàn '' means a specific table , similar to the table in English .

source: In this section , we analyzed the VTB corpus to know whether the diffculties in Vietnamese word segmentation affected the quality of VTB annotations .
target: In this section , we analyzed the VTB corpus to determine whether the difficulties in Vietnamese word segmentation affected the quality of VTB annotations .

source: The analysis results revealed several types of inconsistent annotations , which are also
target: The analysis revealed several types of inconsistent annotations , which are also

source: Vietnamese word segmentation .
target: Vietnamese word segmentation .

source: Our analysis is based on two types of inconsistency : variation and structural inconsistency , whose definitions and details are given below .
target: Our analysis is based on two types of inconsistencies : variation and structural inconsistency , which are defined below .

source: Variation inconsistency : is a sequence of tokens which have more than one way of seg-mentation in the corpus .
target: Variation inconsistency : is a sequence of tokens , which has more than one way of segmentation in the corpus .

source: For example , `` con gái/girl '' can remain as one word , or be segmented into two words `` con '' and `` gái '' .
target: For example , `` con gái/girl '' can remain as one word , or be segmented into two words , `` con '' and `` gái '' .

source: A variation can be an annotation inconsistency , or an ambiguity inVietnamese .
target: A variation can be an annotation inconsistency , or an ambiguity in Vietnamese .

source: While ambiguity cases reflect the diffculty of the language , annotation inconsistencies are usually caused by the confusion in the decision of annotators , which should be eliminated in annotation .
target: While ambiguity cases reflect the difficulty of the language , annotation inconsistencies are usually caused by the confusion in the decision of annotators , which should be eliminated in annotation .

source: We use the term variation instance to refer a single occurence of a variation .
target: We use the term variation instance to refer to a single occurrence of a variation .

source: Structural inconsistency : happens when different sequences have similar structures , thus should be splitted in the same way , but are segmented in different ways in the corpus .

source: In the following section , we presents our detection method for structural inconsistency for classifier nouns and affxes .
target: In the following section , we present our detection method for structural inconsistency for classifier nouns and affixes .

source: The detection method for structural inconsistency of classifier nouns and affxes is simple .
target: The detection method for structural inconsistency of classifier nouns and affixes is simple .

source: First , we collected all affxes and classifier nouns in the VTB corpus . Then , extracted 2-grams containing these affxes or classifier nouns , which also are the structural inconsistencies .
target: We collected all affixes and classifier nouns in the VTB corpus , and then extracted 2-grams containing these affixes or classifier nouns , which are also structural inconsistencies .

source: For example , since " con " is tagged as a classifier noun in VTB , we extracted all 2-grams of " con " including both " con gái / girl " and " con trai / boy " .

target: Even though the sequence , " con trai " is always split into two words throughout the corpus , it can still be an inconsistency , if we consider similar structures such as " con gái " .

source: In other words , by this method , we extract sequences that may be consistent at the surface level , but are not consistent if we consider the higher analysis levels , POS tagging .
target: In other words , by this method , we extract sequences that may be consistent at the surface level , but are not consistent , if we consider the higher analysis levels , POS tagging .

source: According to the VTB POS-tagging annotation guidelines ( Nguyen et al. , c ) , classifier nouns should be separated from the words they modify .
target: According to the VTB POS-tagging annotation guidelines ( Nguyen et al. , c ) , classifier nouns should be separated from the words that they modify .

source: However , in practice it is confusing when the classifier noun can be stand alone as a single word .
target: However , in practice , it is confusing when the classifier noun can be standalone as a single word .

source: For example a classifier noun , e.g . , " con " in " con trai ( boy ) " , or " con gái ( girl ) " , can also be a simple word which means " I ( first person pronoun used by a child when talking to his / her parents ) " , or part of a complex noun " con cái ( children ) " .
target: For example a classifier noun , e.g . , " con " in " con trai ( boy ) " , or " con gái ( girl ) " , can also be a simple word , which means " I ( first person pronoun used by a child when talking to his / her parents ) " , or part of a complex noun " con cái ( children ) " .

source: We organized the inconsistency detected in seven configurations of the original VTB corpus .
target: We organized the inconsistency detected in seven configurations of the original VTB corpus .

source: Then , by using these data sets , we could observe the influence of the different word segmentation criteria on three tasks : automatic word segmenation , text classification , and English-Vietnamese statistical machine translation .
target: Then , by using these data sets , we could observe the influence of the different word segmentation criteria on three tasks : automatic word segmentation , text classification , and English-Vietnamese statistical machine translation .

source: Seven data sets corresponding to different segmentation criteria are organized as follows .
target: Seven data sets corresponding to different segmentation criteria are organized as follows .

source: ORG : The original VTB corpus .
target: ORG : The original VTB corpus .

source: BASE : The original VTB corpus + Manual modification of special characters done in Section 3 .3 .
target: BASE : The original VTB corpus + Manual modification of special characters done in Section 3 .3 .

source: VAR_SPLIT : BASE + split all variations detected in Section 3 .1 .
target: VAR_SPLIT : BASE + split all variations detected in Section 3 .1 .

source: VAR_COMB : BASE + combine all variations detected in Section 3 .1 .
target: VAR_COMB : BASE + combine all variations detected in Section 3 .1 .

source: VAR_FREQ : BASE + select the segmentation with higher frequency among all variations detected in Section 3 .1 .
target: VAR_FREQ : BASE + select the segmentation with higher frequency among all variations detected in Section 3 .1 .

source: STRUCT_NC : BASE + combine all classifier nouns detected in Section 3 .2 with the words they modify .
target: STRUCT_NC : BASE + combine all classifier nouns detected in Section 3 .2 with the words they modify .

source: STRUCT_AFFIX : BASE + combine all suffxes detected in Section 3 .2 with the words they modify .
target: STRUCT_AFFIX : BASE + combine all suffxes detected in Section 3 .2 with the words they modify .

target: These data sets are used in our experiments , as illustrated in Figure 1 .

source: In this section , we briefly describe the task settings and the methods used for word segmentation ( WS ) , text classification ( TC ) , and English-Vietnamese statistical machine translation ( SMT ) .
target: In this section , we briefly describe the task settings and the methods used for word segmentation ( WS ) , text classification ( TC ) , and English-Vietnamese statistical machine translation ( SMT ) .

source: We used YamCha ( Kudo and Matsumoto , 2003 ) , a multi-purpose chunking tool , to train our word segmentation models .
target: We used YamCha ( Kudo and Matsumoto , 2003 ) , a multi-purpose chunking tool , to train our word segmentation models .

source: The core of YamCha is the Support Vector Machine ( SVM ) machine learning method , which has been proved to be effective in NLP tasks .
target: The core of YamCha is the Support Vector Machine ( SVM ) machine learning method , which has been proven to be effective for NLP tasks .

source: For the Vietnamese word segmentation problem , each token is labeled with standard B , I , or O labels , corresponding to beginning , inside , and outside positions , respectively .
target: For the Vietnamese word segmentation problem , each token is labeled with standard B , I , or O labels , corresponding to the beginning , inside , and outside positions , respectively .

source: Label of each token is determined based on the lexical features of two preceding words and two following words of that token .
target: The label of each token is determined based on the lexical features of two preceding words , and the two following words of that token .

source: Since Vietnamese language is not inflectional , we cannot utilize inflection features for word segmentation .
target: Since the Vietnamese language is not inflectional , we cannot utilize inflection features for word segmentation .

source: Each of the seven data sets is splitted into two subsets for training and testing our WS models .
target: Each of the seven data sets is split into two subsets for training and testing our WS models .

source: The training set contains 8443 sentences , and the test set contains 2000 sentences .
target: The training set contains 8443 sentences , and the test set contains 2000 sentences .

source: Text classification is defined as a task of determining for an input document the most suitable topic from the predefined topics .
target: Text classification is defined as a task of determining the most suitable topic from the predefined topics , for an input document .

source: We implemented a text classification system similar to the system presented in ( Nguyen et al. , 2012 ) .
target: We implemented a text classification system similar to the system presented in ( Nguyen et al. , 2012 ) .

source: The difference is that we performed for document level , not for sentence level .
target: The difference is that we performed the task at the document level , instead of at the sentence level .

source: Processing of the system is summarized as follows .
target: The processing of the system is summarized as follows .

source: An input document is preprocessed with word segmentation and stop-word removals .
target: An input document is preprocessed with word segmentation and stop-word removals .

source: Then , the document is represented in the form of a vector of weighted words appearing in the document .
target: Then , the document is represented in the form of a vector of weighted words appearing in the document .

source: The weight is calculated using standard tf-idf product .
target: The weight is calculated using standard tf-idf product .

source: An SVM-based classifier predicts the most probable topic for the vector , which also is the topic of the input document .
target: An SVM-based classifier predicts the most probable topic for the vector , which also is the topic for the input document .

source: In our experiment for comparison of different word segmentation criteria in topic classification , we only vary the word segmentation model used for this task , while fixing other configurations .
target: In our experiment , for comparison of different word segmentation criteria in topic classification , we only vary the word segmentation model used for this task , while fixing other configurations .

source: News articles of five topics : music , stock , entertainment , education , and fashion are used .
target: News articles of five topics : music , stock , entertainment , education , and fashion are used .

source: The sizes of the training and test data sets are summarized in Table 8 .
target: The sizes of the training and test data sets are summarized in Table 8 .

source: A
target: phrase-based SMT system for English-Vietnamese translation was implemented .

source: In this system , we used SRILM ( Stolcke , 2002 ) to build the language model , GIZA++ ( Och and Ney , 2003 ) to train the word-aligned model , and Moses ( Holmqvist et al. , 2007 ) to train the phrase-based statistical translation model .
target: In this system , we used SRILM ( Stolcke , 2002 ) to build the language model , GIZA++ ( Och and Ney , 2003 ) to train the word-aligned model , and Moses ( Holmqvist et al. , 2007 ) to train the phrase-based statistical translation model .

source: Translation results are evaluated using BLUE score ( Papineni et al. , 2002 ) .
target: Translation results are evaluated using the BLUE score ( Papineni et al. , 2002 ) .

source: Both training and test data are word-segmented using the word segmentation models achieved .
target: Both training and test data are word-segmented using the word segmentation models achieved .

source: For the experiment , we used the VCL_EVC bilingual corpus , 18000 pairs of sentences for training , and 1000 pairs for testing .
target: For the experiment , we used the VCL_EVC bilingual corpus , 18000 pairs of sentences for training , and 1000 pairs for testing .

target: Evaluation of word segmentation models trained on different versions of the VTB are given in Table 9 .

target: The experimental results with text classification and English-Vietnamese statistical machine translation are shown in Table 10 and Table 11 , respectively .

source: There are two important conclusions can be drawn from these tables : ( 1 ) Quality of the treebank strongly affects the applications since our BASE model and most of other enhanced models improved the performance of TC and SMT systems ; ( 2 ) " Splitting " seems to be a good solution for word segmentation of controversial cases , including the split of variations , affxes , and classifier nouns .
target: There are two important conclusions that can be drawn from these tables : ( 1 ) The quality of the treebank strongly affects the applications , since our BASE model and most of the other enhanced models improved the performance of TC and SMT systems ; ( 2 ) " Splitting " seems to be a good solution for word segmentation for controversial cases , including the split of variations , affxes , and classifier nouns .

source: According to the result in Table 9 , the VAR_SPLIT criterion gives the highest WS performance .
target: According to the result in Table 9 , the VAR_SPLIT criterion gives the highest WS performance .

target: With the exception of STRUCT_NC , all of the modifications to the original VTB corpus increase the performance of WS .

source: However , the word segmentation criterion with higher performance is not necessarily a better criterion , but a criterion should also be judged through applications of word segmentation .
target: However , the word segmentation criterion with higher performance is not necessarily a better criterion , but a criterion should also be judged through applications of word segmentation .

source: In both SMT and TC experiments , the BASE model which is based on the manually-modified inconsistency of special characters , achieved better results than the ORG model .
target: In both SMT and TC experiments , the BASE model , which is based on the manually-modified inconsistency of special characters , achieved better results than the ORG model .

target: In particular , in the TC experiment , the BASE model achieved 0 .66 point higher than ORG , which is a significant improvement .

target: The results support the conclusion that the quality of the word-segmentation corpus is very important for building NLP applications .

source: The SMT results show that three out of six augmented models , VAR_SPLIT , VAR_FREQ and BASE , gave higher performance than the ORG configuration .
target: The SMT results show that three out of six augmented models , VAR_SPLIT , VAR_FREQ and BASE , performed better than the ORG configuration .

target: Among them , the best-performing model , VAR_SPLIT achieved 36 .91 BLEU score , which is 0 .55 higher than ORG .

source: In TC results , all six augmented models have higher results than ORG .
target: In TC results , all six augmented models achieved higher results than ORG .

source: In general , the augmented models are better than the ORG .
target: In general , the augmented models performed better than the ORG .

source: Additionally , because our automatic methods for inconsistency detection could not cover all types of inconsistency in word segmentation annotation , further improvement of corpus quality is demanded .
target: Additionally , because our automatic methods for inconsistency detection could not cover all of the types of inconsistencies in word segmentation annotation , further improvement of corpus quality is demanded .

source: Comparing the results of STRUCT_AFFIX and STRUCT_NC with BASE in WS , TC , and SMT , we can observe that combining affxes with their head nouns resulted in slightly better results for WS , TC , and does not change the performance of SMT .

source: However , the combination of clasifier nouns with their head nouns had negative effects on WS and SMT .
target: However , the combination of classifier nouns with their head nouns had negative effects on WS and SMT .

source: Another intention of our experiment is to compare two solutions for controversial cases of word segmentation , splitting and combining .
target: Another part of the scope of our experiment is to compare two solutions for controversial cases of word segmentation , splitting and combining .

source: Splitting and combining variations are reflected by VAR_COMB and VAR_SPLIT , while STRUCT_AFFIX and STRUCT_NC represent the combination of affxes or classifier nouns with the words they modify .
target: Splitting and combining variations are reflected by VAR_COMB and VAR_SPLIT , while STRUCT_AFFIX and STRUCT_NC represent the combination of affixes or classifier nouns with the words that they modify .

source: STRUCT_AFFIX and STRUCT_NC are contrasted with BASE where affxes and classifier nouns remain untouched .
target: STRUCT_AFFIX and STRUCT_NC are contrasted with BASE where affxes and classifier nouns remain untouched .

source: Comparing VAR_COMB and VAR_SPLIT in both TC experiment and SMT experiment , we see that the VAR_SPLIT results are better in both cases .
target: Comparing VAR_COMB and VAR_SPLIT in both the TC experiment and SMT experiment , we see that the VAR_SPLIT results are better in both cases .

source: Since the ratio of combined variations in the ORG corpus is 60 .9 % , it can be observed that splitting seems to be better than combining for WS , TC and SMT .
target: Since the ratio of combined variations in the ORG corpus is 60 .9 % , it can be observed that splitting seems to be better than combining for WS , TC and SMT .

source: In this paper , we have shown a quantitative analysis of the diffculties in word segmentation , through the detection of problematic cases in the Vietnamese treebank .
target: In this paper , we have provided a quantitative analysis of the difficulties in word segmentation , through the detection of problematic cases in the Vietnamese Treebank .

source: Based on the analysis , we automatically created data representing the different word segmentation criteria , and evaluated the criteria indirectly through their applications .
target: Based on the analysis , we automatically created data that represent the different word segmentation criteria , and evaluated the criteria indirectly through their applications .

source: Our experimental results showed that manual modification done for annotation of spe-cial characters and most of other word segmentation criteria significantly improved the performances of automatic word segmentation , text classification and statistical machine translation , comparing with the use of the original VTB corpus .
target: Our experimental results showed that manual modification , done for annotation of special characters , and most other word segmentation criteria , significantly improved the performances of automatic word segmentation , text classification and statistical machine translation , in comparison with the use of the original VTB corpus .

source: Since the VTB corpus is the first effort in building a treebank for Vietnamese , and is the only corpus publicly available for NLP research , this study contributes to further improvement of the corpus quality , which is essential for building effcient NLP systems .
target: Since the VTB corpus is the first effort in building a treebank for Vietnamese , and is the only corpus that is publicly available for NLP research , this study contributes to further improvement of the corpus quality , which is essential for building efficient NLP systems .

source: Face retrieval on large-scale news video datasets
target: Face retrieval in large-scale news video datasets

source: Face retrieval in news video has been identified as a challenging task due to huge variations in visual appearance of human face .
target: Face retrieval in news video has been identified as a challenging task due to huge variations in the visual appearance of the human face .

source: Although there are several approaches proposed to cope with this problem , their extremely high computational cost limits their scalability on largescale video datasets that may contain millions faces of hundreds characters .
target: Although several approaches have been proposed to deal with this problem , their extremely high computational cost limits their scalability to large-scale video datasets that may contain millions of faces of hundreds of characters .

source: In this paper , we introduce approaches for face retrieval which are scalable on such datasets while maintaining competitive performances with the state-of-the-art approaches .
target: In this paper , we introduce approaches to face retrieval that are scalable to such datasets while maintaining competitive performances with state-of-the-art approaches .

source: To utilize the variability of face appearances in video , we use a set of face images called face-track to represent for the appearance of a character in a video shot .
target: To utilize the variability of face appearances in video , we use a set of face images called face track to represent the appearance of a character in a video shot .

source: Our first proposal is an approach for extracting face-tracks .
target: Our first proposal is an approach to extracting face tracks .

source: We use a point tracker for exploring the connections between detected faces belonging to the same character , then grouping them into one face-track .
target: We use a point tracker to explore the connections between detected faces belonging to the same character and , then group them into one face track .

source: We present techniques to make the approach robust to common problems caused by sudden illumination changes , partial occlusions , and scattered appearances of characters in news videos .
target: We present techniques to make the approach robust to common problems caused by sudden illumination changes , partial occlusions , and scattered appearances of characters in news videos .

source: In the second proposal , we introduce an efficient approach to match face-tracks for retrieval .
target: In the second proposal , we introduce an efficient approach to matching face tracks for retrieval .

source: Instead of using all faces in face-tracks to compute their similarity , our approach select representative faces for each face-track .
target: Instead of using all the faces in the face tracks to compute their similarity , our approach selects representative faces for each face track .

source: The representative faces are sampled from the original face-track .
target: The representative faces are sampled from the original face track .

source: As a result , we significantly reduce the computational cost for face-track matching while taking into account variability of faces in face-tracks for high matching accuracy .

source: In this paper , we investigate face retrieval on large-scale news video datasets .
target: In this paper , we investigate face retrieval in large-scale news video datasets .

source: Our contributions is 3-fold .
target: Our contribution is threefold .

source: Firstly , we presented practical problems when a tracker is used to extract face-tracks in news videos .
target: First , we present the practical problems encountered when a tracker is used to extract face tracks in news videos .

source: Based on that , we introduce techniques and solutions to bypass the problems for robust face-track extraction .
target: Based on these , we introduce techniques and solutions to overcome these problems to achieve robust face-track extraction .

source: Secondly , we present an approach for face-track matching which significantly reduces the computational cost and achive competitive performance compared to state-of-the-art approaches .
target: Second , we present an approach for face-track matching that significantly reduces the computational cost while achieving competitive performance compared with state-of-the-art approaches .

source: Thirdly , we prepare , evaluate state-of-the-art face retreival approaches , and publish real-world face-track datasets whose scale have not been considered in literature ever .
target: Third , we prepare datasets , evaluate state-of-the-art face retrieval approaches , and publish real-world face-track datasets of such scales that have never been considered in the literature .

source: Recommend-Me : recommending query regions for image search
target: Recommend-Me : recommending query regions for image search

source: This paper presents a novel recommendation system , named Recommend-Me , to faciliate users in searching and exploring images of an unknown image database .
target: This paper presents a novel recommendation system , named Recommend-Me , to facilitate users in searching and exploring images in unknown image databases .

source: Given an initial query image , Recommend-Me automatically introduces its recommendations to users .
target: Given an initial query image , Recommend-Me automatically shows its recommendations to users .

source: The recommendations indicate which and how frequent items in the initial query image occur in the database .
target: The recommendations indicate which and how frequent items in the initial query image occur in the database .

source: So that , users can make their own decisions before any actual search .
target: In this way , users can make their own decisions before any actual search .

source: If there is a recommendation matched their search intention , relevant search results are ensured .
target: If there is a recommendation matching their search intention , relevant search results are ensured .

source: Otherwise , users should refine their initial query image for a better query sample .
target: Otherwise , users should refine their initial query image for a better query sample .

source: Or , they can start exploring the database by using the recommended items as hints .
target: Or , they can start exploring the database by using the recommended items as hints .

source: Recommend-Me helps users to avoid unnecessary trials and poor searching experiences .
target: Recommend-Me helps users to avoid unnecessary trials and poor searching experiences .

source: We introduce an efficient approach for Recommend-Me to deal with quantifying occurences of multiple candidate items over images of the database .
target: We describe an efficient approach for Recommend-Me to deal with quantifying occurrences of multiple candidate items in the images of the database .

source: Instead of scanning the database for each candidate item repspectively , the approach enumerate occurences of multiple candidate items simultaneously by investigating pairs of highly similar regions , knowing one pair is formed by a region in the intial image and a region in an image of the database .
target: Instead of scanning the database for each candidate item , the approach enumerate occurrences of multiple candidate items simultaneously by investigating pairs of highly similar regions , knowing one pair is formed by a region in the initial image and a region in an image of the database .

source: We formulate the problem of finding such pairs as an opmization problem , which can be solved by a branch-and-bound algorithm .
target: We formulate the problem of finding such pairs as an optimization problem , which can be solved by a branch-and-bound algorithm .

source: Experiments conducted on a real-life and publicly available dataset demonstrate the efficiency , the robustness and a promissing application of our system .
target: Experiments conducted on a real-life and publicly available dataset demonstrate the efficiency , robustness , and promising application of our system .

source: With the advances of modern technology , a large amount of digital images nowadays can be created and stored easily .
target: Thanks to the advances of modern technology , a large amount of digital images can be easily created and stored nowadays .

source: As a result , the exponential growth of image repositories creates the urgent needs for searching images . Because of its importance and wide applications , image search has attracted more interest in recent years .
target: The resulting exponential growth of image repositories , however , has created an urgent need for effective ways of searching images .

source: In a typical scenario of image search , users supply a query item which is usually represented by a region cropped from an image .
target: Moreover , image search has gained interest in recent years because of its importance and wide range of applications . In a typical scenario , users supply a query item , which is usually a region cropped from an image .

source: The search system then returns a list of relevant images retrieved from a database .
target: The search system then returns a list of relevant images retrieved from a database .

source: The images are expected to contain the query item .
target: The images are expected to contain the query item .

source: Several extensive works have been conducted with great interest on improving search performance \CITE .
target: Extensive studies have been conducted with an eye to improving the performance of this sort of search \CITE .

source: However , regardless of the powerfulness of state-of-the-art search techniques , there are still cases in which users are disappointed with search results .
target: However , regardless of the powerfulness of state-of-the-art search techniques , there are still cases in which users are disappointed with their search results .

source: The reason is because relevant items are not in the database .
target: The reason is that relevant items are not in the database .

source: Under such circumstances , whatever the search technique is , results are obviously irrelevant and unexpected .
target: Under such circumstances , whatever the search technique is , results are obviously irrelevant and unexpected .

source: A normal user without prior knowledge about the retrieved database has no choice but search by trial-and-error .
target: A normal user without prior knowledge about a database has no choice but to search it by trial-and-error .

source: We tackle this problem to facilitate users in searching and exploring images of such unknown database .
target: We decided to tackle this problem to help users in searching and exploring images in unknown databases .

source: Our proposal is a novel recommendation system , named Recommend-Me .
target: Our proposal is a novel recommendation system , named Recommend-Me .

source: The expected scheme can be described as follows ( see Figure \REF for an example ) .
target: The envisioned scheme can be described as follows ( see Figure \REF for an example ) .

source: Given an unknown database and an initial query image , our Recommend-Me automatically presents its recommendations to user .
target: Given an unknown database and an initial query image , Recommend-Me automatically presents its recommendations to the user .

source: One recommendation is one item , bounded by a rectangular region , in the initial query image .
target: One recommendation is one item , bounded by a rectangular region , in the initial query image .

source: Each recommended item is assigned a number to clarify how many images of the database it occurs .
target: Each recommended item is assigned a number to show in how many images of the database it occurs .

source: Items with higher assigned numbers will be more recommended .
target: Items with larger assigned numbers will be more recommended .

source: By providing such recommendations , Recommend-Me supports users to :
target: By providing such recommendations , Recommend-Me helps users to :

source: - avoid unexpected search experience with poor queries that are subjectively ( and sometimes randomly ) selected ,
target: - avoid unexpected search experience with poor queries that are subjectively ( and sometimes randomly ) selected ,

source: - rapidly refine the initial query image before any actual search , if the recommendations show that current search intention can not return relevant results ,
target: - rapidly refine the initial query image before any actual search , if the recommendations show that current search intention can not return relevant results ,

source: - explore the database using the recommendations as hints .
target: - explore the database using the recommendations as hints .

source: Recommend-Me is a pure visual recommendation system .
target: Recommend-Me is a pure visual recommendation system .

source: No extra information or knowledge is required for input but an initial query image and a retrieved database .
target: No extra information or knowledge is required for an input besides an initial query image and a database . // < " and the name of the database " ? ? Or " and the location and name of the database " ? ? >

source: To automatically generate recommendations , we need to address several critical issues .
target: To automatically generate recommendations , we need to address several issues .

source: First , there is a huge pool of candidate items in the initial query image .
target: First , there tends to be a huge pool of candidate items in the initial query image .

source: Basically , any rectangular region in the image can be considered as a candidate item .
target: Basically , any rectangular region in the image can be considered as a candidate item .

source: Examining all of them requires enormous computational cost .
target: Examining all of them would incur an enormous computational cost .

source: Second , even if a candidate item is known , enumerating its occurrences in the database is not trivial because it is subject to many variations such as viewpoint and scale changes , rotation or occlusion .
target: Second , even if a candidate item is known , enumerating its occurrences in the database is a not trivial task because it is subject to many variations in viewpoint , scale , rotation , occlusion , etc .

source: Furthermore , scanning over all regions in images of the database will inevitably be prohibitive , if not infeasible for practical purposes .
target: Furthermore , the cost of scanning all regions of the images of the database will inevitably be prohibitive for practical purposes .

source: In this paper , we employ state-of-the-art techniques such as SIFT and Bag-of-Words ( BoW ) model to handle matching regions under variations .
target: In this paper , we employ state-of-the-art techniques such as SIFT and the Bag-of-Words ( BoW ) model to handle the task of matching regions with the above variations .

source: Our main focus is an efficient approach for quantifying occurences of candidate items over the database to generate recommendations .
target: Our main focus is to devise an efficient approach for quantifying occurrences of candidate items in the database in order to generate recommendations .

source: The efficiency advantages of our approach come from various methodologies .
target: The advantage in efficiency comes from our use of various methodologies .

source: Based on an observation that users are mostly interested in object-like items , we use a selective search approach proposed by Van de Sande et al . \CITE to sample regions bounding object-like items in all images as a preprocessing step .
target: Based on the observation that users are mostly interested in object-like items , we decided to use a selective search approach proposed by Van de Sande et al . \CITE to sample regions bounding object-like items in all images as a preprocessing step .

source: By applying the approach instead of other naive sampling approach such as sliding windows , the number of items ( i .e . regions ) that need to be processed in each image dramatically reduces .
target: By applying this approach instead of a naive sampling approach such as sliding windows , we were able to dramatically reduce the number of items ( i .e . regions ) that need to be processed in each image .

source: Given two sets of regions , one contains regions of candidate items in the initial query image and the other contains regions of items in images of the database .
target: Given two sets of regions , one containing regions of candidate items in the initial query image and the other containing regions of items in images of the database , our task is to find occurrences of all candidate items in the database .

source: Finding occurences of all candidate items in the database can be equally treated as finding pairs of matched regions , knowing a pair is formed by a region in one of the sets with a region in the other .
target: This task can be equivalently treated as finding pairs of matched regions , knowing that a pair is formed by a region in one of the sets with a region in the other .

source: So , if top region pairs with sufficient high similarity scores are found , we can enumerate occurences of the items .
target: So , if the top region pairs are found with sufficiently high similarity scores , we can enumerate the occurrences of the items .

source: Based on these insights , we make an yet another efficiency boost by formulating the problem as an optimization problem which can be solved by applying a branh-and-bound algorithm .
target: Based on this insight , we can boost efficiency yet again by formulating the problem as an optimization problem that can be solved by applying a branch-and-bound algorithm .

source: In order to do that , we introduce a novel representation based on hierarchical structure to describe a set of region pairs and a corresponding function bounding the similarity scores of pairs over such a set .
target: In order to do that , we introduce a novel representation based on a hierarchical structure describing a set of region pairs and a corresponding function bounding the similarity scores of pairs over such a set .

source: Related Works .
target: Related Work .

source: With respect to discovering common items , Recommend-Me is related to recent studies on mining common items in image databases such as \CITE .
target: On the topic of discovering common items , Recommend-Me is related to recent studies on mining common items in image databases such as \CITE .

source: However , in contrast to these studies , Recommend-Me targets items which are shared by both an image database and user interest limited in an input initial image .
target: However , in contrast to these studies , Recommend-Me targets items which are shared by both an image database and the user 's particular interest inthe input initial image .

source: Meanwhile , \CITE only aim at finding common items within the database .
target: Meanwhile , \CITE only aims at finding common items within the database .

source: One can employ these techniques to our problem by firstly figuring out common items among images of the database , then looking them up in the initial query image again for recommendations .
target: One can employ these techniques to solve our problem by first identifying common items among the images of the database , then looking them up in the initial query image again to make recommendations .

source: However , by doing that , extra costs for mining unnecessary items , which appear in the database but the initial query image , arise accordingly .
target: However , doing that incurs the extra cost of mining unnecessary items that appear in the database , but not in the initial query image .

source: One of the most related works to Recommend-Me for query suggestion is proposed by Zha et al in \CITE .
target: One of the most related studies to ours is that of Zha et al in \CITE .

source: They introduced a system called Visual Query Suggestion ( VQS ) which simultanously provides both keyword and image suggestions for users .
target: They introduced a system , called Visual Query Suggestion ( VQS ) , that simultaneously provides both keyword and image suggestions to users .

source: There are clear differences between our Recommend-Me and VQS .
target: There are clear differences between Recommend-Me and VQS .

source: VQS requires an initial text query for suggestion formulation and its suggestions are both keywords and images .
target: VQS requires an initial text query for formulating the suggestion , and its suggestions are both keywords and images .

source: On the other hand , Recommend-Me takes an image as input and its outputs are regions in the image .
target: On the other hand , Recommend-Me takes an image as input , and its outputs are regions in the image .

source: Recommend-Me is a query suggestion system based on pure visual information .
target: Recommend-Me is a query suggestion system based on pure visual information .

source: Above all , although both Recommend-Me and VQS aim at facilitating users in searching images , the targeted problems are different .
target: Above all , although both Recommend-Me and VQS aim at helping users search for images , their targeted problems are different .

source: VQS proposes to help users to overcome query ambiguity formulation by precisely expressing search intents , assuming relevant items are always available .
target: VQS proposes to help users to overcome their tendency to formulate ambiguous queries by precisely expressing search intents , assuming the relevant items are always available .

source: Meanwhile , Recommend-Me supports users to select queries based on the existence of their relevant items in the retrieved database .
target: Meanwhile , Recommend-Me helps users to select queries based on the existence of relevant items in the retrieved database .

source: To the best of our knowledge , Recommend-Me is the first attempt towards its targeted suggestion scheme .
target: To the best of our knowledge , Recommend-Me is the first attempt at this sort of targeted suggestion scheme .

source: From technical point of view , our solution is motivated by recent works for object localization and subimage retrieval based on branch-and-bound optimization \CITE .
target: From a technical point of view , our solution is motivated by recent work on object localization and subimage retrieval based on branch-and-bound optimization \CITE .

source: However , ours is differentiated in the way we represent sets of region pairs , instead of sets of regions only .
target: However , ours is differentiated from the other studies in that we represent sets of region pairs , instead of only sets of regions .

source: ESS and ESR \CITE use coordinate intervals for their presentation .
target: ESS and ESR \CITE use coordinate intervals for their presentation .

source: Meanwhile , we utilize hierarchical structures in order to do that , since our regions are discrete .
target: In contrast , we utilize hierarchical structures in order to do that , since our regions are discrete .

source: Although coordinate intervals as in ESS ( or ESR ) can be extended to represent set of region pairs , such criterion may suffer the branch-and-bound algorithm from curse-of-dimensionality problem since the number of dimension required is at least doubled .
target: Although coordinate intervals as in ESS ( or ESR ) can be extended to represent sets of region pairs , such a criterion in the context of the branch-and-bound algorithm may suffer from the curse-of-dimensionality problem since the number of dimensions required at least doubles .

source: Finally , ours and ESS , ESR do not share common approach to construct bounding quality function and to compute bounding values over the sets .
target: Finally , ESS , ESR and Recommend-Me differ in that they have different approaches to constructing a bounding quality function and to computing bounding values over the sets .

source: The framework of Recommend-Me consists of 4 main steps towards formulating final recommendations for users .
target: The framework of Recommend-Me consists of four main steps .

target: Figure \REF summarizes the pipeline .

source: Step 1 : Candidate item selection in images .
target: Step 1 : Select candidate items in images .

source: In this paper , we introduced a new system , named Recommend-Me , for visual query suggestion .
target: We described oursystem , named Recommend-Me , for making visual query suggestions .

source: Given an initial query image and a retrieved database , Recommend-Me introduces recommendations that imposes which and how frequent items in the initial query image appear in the database .
target: Given an initial query image and a retrieved database , Recommend-Me gives recommendations that impose conditions on which and how frequent items in the initial query image appear in the database .

source: Such recommendations support users to select search query , to rapidly refine the initial query image or to explore the database .
target: Such recommendations help users to select the search query , to rapidly refine the initial query image or to explore the database .

source: An efficient solution to make Recommend-Me practical is presented .
target: An efficient solution to make Recommend-Me practical was also presented .

source: To the best of our knowledge , Recommend-Me is the first attempt toward its targeted suggestion scheme .
target: To the best of our knowledge , Recommend-Me is the first attempt at developing a targeted suggestion scheme .
